loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used for the repair and maintenance of her boarding house. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to pay for repair and maintenance of her boarding house. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams of being successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintainance of her boarding house.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for seven years. In this business, he mainly sells toys.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge has been limited capital, which he believes can be sorted through this loan. 

Ramadhan is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy more toys for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy more toys for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a freezer to store his fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a tool kit, and various electrical and electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Botom's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Botom is a 34-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee, which she has been doing for eighteen years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 26,000 per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is the fifth loan for Botom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her family and give them enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, Botom will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 58 years old, married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and piglets.

Edna has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from buying and selling of piglets.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and piglets.

loans.name: Kab's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Kab is aged 46 years old and married. She and her husband have two children. Kab and her husband earn a living through farming rice on three hectares of farmland and they have been in this business for ten years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 25,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the sixth loan for Kab while the other member is taking her third loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have a bigger crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
At the age of 22, Melanie started her business, a sari-sari store. She sells various grocery items in their village like soap, shampoo, toothpaste and biscuits. Now, Melanie is 27 years old. She is married, has two kids and is still managing the business. She has already been five years in this type of business.

Melanie wishes to have good health and further develop the business. She wants to extend the products she sells to her customers. Melanie is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy spices, drinks and breads to sell. She hopes to increase her sales and income as well to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spices, drinks and breads to sell.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina runs a business in front of her house selling brake oil, engine oil, battery acid, etc. Santina earns a good income from selling these items.  Santina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy more stock to sell. Santina lives in a town on the main road, so many people come to buy her products. She is open every day. She has operated her business since 2001. She started it with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy brake oil, engine oil and battery acid.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak is 34 years old and married. She lives in a rural village in the district of Moung Russey and the province of Battambang. She has four children, two of whom are in school. To earn a living, Lak has been growing pineapples. She supplements this income by selling grocery items. Her current business earns her about 11,000 KHR per day but she manages to save about 6,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses. 

Lak has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully paid back the previous loan, which helped her relieve her family's burden. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay to have the field plowed for planting pineapples. She hopes to get a high yield from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay to have the field plowed for planting pineapples.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Shiela works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Shiela is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, salt, cream, etc. for her bakery business.

Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, salt, cream, etc. for her bakery business.

loans.name: Hideliza

texts.en:
Hideliza works hard to support her family. Hideliza is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods and tools in the Philippines.

Hideliza requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional stock to sell.

Hideliza has been in this business for one year now.

Hideliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Aged 35 years old, Sour is a rural villager from the Kandal Stoeng district earning a living through working at garment factory while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to better support the family. Engaged in this business for 15 years, Sour is able to earn about US$11 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sour has been with VisionFund for five cycles and she completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work. She hopes this will enable her to reduce transportation fees.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Chanleap

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Takeo province’s Bati district, Cheanleap is a 28-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are dependent on her and still too young for school. She has been growing rice and coconuts in the village to make a living. She can earn about US$3 per day from the current business and can manage to save about US$1 each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Chanleap has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is asking for another loan to buy buffaloes to help her in her farming business. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living and hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy buffaloes to help her in her farming business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old, married with two children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, candies, snack foods, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, candies, snack foods, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and has three children. Jocelyn is married and has one child who is in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale and also pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of eight children and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for five years.  

Rose was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

Despite the high level of bad weather, and though she does not have a stable shelter. Rose believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income to the other employees and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Naderson

texts.en:
Naderson lives in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. He is a water vendor, a business he started out due to the high demand of water in the populated area. Besides this, he is also a farmer.

Naderson was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya Shillings to carry out repairs on his piping. The major challenge in the businesses are harsh climatic conditions especially affecting the farming. He looks forward to owning other water distribution outlets in future.

loans.use: To carry out repairs on his piping.

loans.name: Loern's Group

texts.en:
Loern is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn to a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for 10 years. She earns about 12,000 KHR a day. 

Loern is requesting a loan from VisionFund for 300,000 KHR for each group member.   As the leader, she is will use her portion to buy a cart for supporting her paddy business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to purchase a cart for supporting her paddy business.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Sin is 29 years old and lives in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district in Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support her family, Sin and her husband farm rice and catch fish. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 21,000 KHR per day but she manages to save about 9,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sin has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She has completely paid back the past loans, which helped relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sin will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income. In this way, she will be able to earn a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Totesoda

texts.en:
Totesoda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business leasing farm equipment in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farm equipment for her business.

Totesoda has been in this business for 32 years. Totesoda earns additional income from farming rice.

Totesoda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farm equipment.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of 1,000.00 USD. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, candles, cigarettes, ketchup, coca-cola, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years of age, married and has one child. She manages a furniture making business in their village. Her husband is her partner in growing the business. They started the business with minimal capital; they are doing their best to grow the business.

Having a better way of living is the greatest dream of Marites. She has to strive and extend the products they offer to their customers to gain income. Marites is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy wood and burnish for her business. They will make new designs of chairs, dining tables and cabinets.

loans.use: to buy wood and burnish for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old, and married with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store. Josephine has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming seaweeds.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase basins and wheelbarrows

loans.name: Nabonswende Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADIDIA représente le groupe NABONSWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 02ans et le moins âgé a 07mois. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 07ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 et au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 20complets pagnes  simple et 10complets de pagnes  bazin.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne étendre la limite de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. KADIDIA, the representative of the group NABONSWENDE, is married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 2 years old, and the youngest is 7 months old. None go to school, and she has three persons to support. 

Ms. KADIDIA has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for seven years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market and at the big market. Her customers are both women and men. She wants to purchase 20 plain outfits of 'pagne' cloth and 10 damask outfits of 'pagne' cloth. 

She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase plain and damask outfits made of 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Ayikoè

texts.fr: Afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses clients, Ayikoè âgé de 42ans fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des boissons qu’il revend dans  une boutique. Il est père d’01 enfant de 09ans scolarisé et a pour conjointe une coiffeuse. Les profits tirés de la vente lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et de rendre son activité pérenne.
texts.en: To meet the needs of his customers, Ayikoè, aged 42, it applying for his first WAGES loan to purchase some beverages, which he sells in a store. He is the father of a 9-year-old child, who is in school. His wife is a hairdresser. The profits derived from the sales will enable him to support his family and make his business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de algunas herramientas y equipo para hacer mejor los queques y panes, además de materia prima. Con estas compras espera obtener una mejor producción y en más cantidad para ofrecerle a los habitantes de las comunidad vecinas y un producto de mejor calidad y obtener poco más de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de repostería  y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Karina is 30 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings, who are her highest priority.  

With her loan, she would like to purchase some tools and equipment to make cakes and breads better, as well as raw ingredients.  With these purchases, she hopes to have a better production and greater quantity, in order to offer the members of the neighboring communities a better quality product.  She also hopes to earn a little more money and thus improve her family's living conditions, invest a little more in the area of pastries and also reach some goals.

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has never had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with greater ease and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to produce pastries.

loans.name: Zenen

texts.en:
Zenen is from Ubay, Bohol where she has been raising rice, her sole source of income, for 13 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to expedite the growth of her rice and protect it from sickness.

In the future, Zenen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Josué

texts.es: Josué, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así poder seguir estudiando y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Josué is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his highest priority.

With his loan, he would like to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and pay for labor for tending the coffee crop.  He would also like to buy some copperwood plants to replant at the beginning of the rainy season.  This is to increase the density of plants, in addition to taking advantage of the good soil fertility and climatic and other conditions that favor the coffee crop.

With these improvements to the crop, he hopes to earn a little more money and thus be able to continue studying and improving his family's living conditions.  He would also like to invest a little more in the crop and also achieve some goals.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to tend to the coffee crop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 57 years old and is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Lilia has been in this business for thirty-five years. In the future, Lilia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. Her husband is a constructional worker and earns about 5,000,000 VND a month. Yen is also a constructional worker. She pours concrete in constructions, which she has been doing for three years. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND a month. 
 
Yen is requesting her second loan from SEDA for 9,632,000 VND, which she will use to buy constructional protection tools and tools to pour concrete productively. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009.  In the future, she wants to buy a concrete pouring machine.

loans.use: to purchase constructional protection tools and tools to pour concrete productively.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
From buying vegetables and root crops in the market and selling them in different villages, Ma. Teresa now has a stall in the market selling a variety of vegetables. She shares that what she has now is just the fruit of her struggle in running the business. Ma. Teresa is a widowed mother of five children who are attending school.

After 12 years of running the business, Ma. Teresa is able to provide her children basic necessities and allowances in school. She wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy beans, carrots and cabbage to sell. She hopes to increase her income to further take care of her children's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy beans, carrots and cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a piggery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Menerva has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Menerva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Abavumvu Gahinga Group

texts.fr:
Félicien est membre du groupe  ABAVUMVU GAHINGA , Il est marie  et est agé de 65 ans avec 4 enfants dont le plus grand a 40 ans et le plus petit a 15 ans. il a étudie les étude primaires .

Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les ruches modernes car il fait l`élevage des abailles pour vendre le miel.

Il n`attend aucune difficultes pour le remboursement. ses strategies pour la croissance de son activité est de demander d`autres crédit pour financer son business.

ses ambitions est d`être l`apiculteur proffessionnel et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants
texts.en:
Félicien is a member of the group ABAVUMVU GAHINGA. He is married and is 65 years old with 4 children of whom the oldest is 40 years old and the youngest is 15 years old. He studied primary school.

He is requesting this loan to buy modern hives since he breeds bees to sell honey.

He doesn't expect any difficulties in repayment. His strategies for the growth of his business are to ask for other loans to finance his business.

His ambitions are to be a professional beekeeper and for his family to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy modern hives.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Luis sigue con la misma actividad de la fabricación de Guinches y mescladoras, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un motor y materiales para su trabajo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramienta y materiales para la fabricación de sus productos ya que tiene pedidos en esta época ya que tiene mucha demanda de este productos.
texts.en:
Luis continues with his business manufacturing winches and cement mixers.  

He says that the previous loan went well for him, since he used it to buy a motor and materials for his work.  

This time, he is applying for a loan to purchase tools and materials for the manufacture of his products, since he already has orders for the season and a lot of demand for these products.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.es: La Sra. Constancia sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para el anticrético de una tienda  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería ropa por mayor ya  que incremento sus ventas y es necesario para incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Constancia continues to work buying and selling used clothing. She says that her previous loan was a a success, which she used for an antichresis rental arrangement for a store. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk, because her sales have increased and she needs more clothing to boost her profits. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor tiene 26 años y es casado con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de 2 años, el Sr. Víctor se dedica a la confección de trajes (especialidad sacos) en su sastrería que se encuentra que se en la zona Canadá,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Víctor va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de tela por rollo para la confección de sus prendas de vestir,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Víctor enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el de no contar con la maquinaria necesaria para la confección de sus prendas de vestir y con las ganancias seguirá comprando materiales y maquinaria para mejorar su taller de confección, el Sr. Víctor es una persona joven Emprendedora con gamas de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 26 years old, married and with one child, who is 2 years old.  Victor makes his living sewing suits (with a specialty in jackets) in his tailoring shop, which is located in the Canadá area.

This loan is his first with the institution.  Victor is going to use this loan to buy bolts of cloth to make his garments.  His reason for applying for this loan is to increase his working capital.  Victor faces challenges in his business, which are not having the necessary machinery for making his garments.  With his earnings, he will continue buying materials and machinery to improve his tailoring workshop.

Victor is a young, enterprising person with a desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for making suit pants, jackets and vests.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising livestock. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional livestock for her business. Marites has been raising livestock for four years now and has borrowed four loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three piglets to fatten up, and feed and vitamins

loans.name: Mariyan

texts.en:
Mariyan is a recurrent client of Yehu Microfinance Trust. She’s married and her husband is a driver. He works as a driver for a transportation firm and they live in Kisauni. 

Mariyan has had a grocery store since 1998. She’s repaid several loans to date and is asking for this one to buy beverages, baked goods, sugar, tea, etc. to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. With a great variety of products to offer her customers, she will earn a larger profit margin, which will help her improve her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, sugar, tea, etc. for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a very hard-working person. She explains that she has been able to get ahead thanks to her effort. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it. 

Today, she comes again, to be able to supply her general store with basic staples such as beverages and soft drinks. These drinks will enable her to continue offering a good variety and good prices to her clients. She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy beverages and soft drinks

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es: El grupo “CLUB DE LA AMISTAD” es uno de nuestros grupos recurrentes ellos se encuentran pasando el ciclo 24 son puntuales en sus cuotas grupales cada uno de sus integrantes están dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio. Margarita tiene 49 años es casada con 3 hijos. Trabaja en su bodega que puso en su casa haces 2 años. El préstamo que se le dio lo utilizara para comprar más productos para su bodega así como arroz, azúcar, bebidas, dulces. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Margarita es la segunda del lado derecho viste blusa  beige.
texts.en: The “CLUB DE LA AMISTAD” group is one of our recurrent groups. They are in their 24th cycle and are punctual with their group payments. Each member makes a living in different business activities. Margarita is 49 years old, and is married with three children. She works in her store which she opened in her home two years ago. She will use the loan to buy more products for her store such as rice, sugar, beverages and sweets. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Margarita is the second from the right wearing a beige blouse.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Marcia Hellen

texts.es:
Marcia,  45 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, madre de cuatro hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa. Es un cliente Kiva,  está muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado porque poco a poco gracias al financiamiento obtenido ha ido creciendo como comerciante, apoyada por sus hijos quien la impulsa a salir   adelante.
Está requiriendo de su segundo  financiamiento para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, cazado, cosméticos, maniquines, Uno de sus propósitos  a realizar es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su negocio para ampliarlo mas hasta convertirlo en una tienda solo de ropa, para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcia is 45 years old, lives in the city of León, and is mother to four children. She is a trader, who works selling clothing. She is a Kiva client, and is very grateful for the support provided because little by little, thanks to the financing she has received she has gradually grown as a trader, supported by her children who push her to succeed.

Marcia is requesting her second loan to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, shoes, cosmetics and mannequins. One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of her business to expand it more until she can make it into a clothes store alone, to boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, cosmetics and mannequins,

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 47 years old and is married. She has two children who attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Luisa has an ambulant business selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fourteen years. She has requested a PHP 24,500 loan through NWTF to buy more spices and vegetables to sell. 

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 15,000. This loan will be used to buy more supplies in bulk, such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers. As a result, she will be able to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies in bulk, such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries for her store, like canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, sugar, soap, and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and to set up a dedicated oven for stained glass production

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla vit avec sa femme et son enfant de 01 an à Lomé. Âgé de 32ans, il revend des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2010. Aidé par 01 personne, il s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend à ses clients dans une boutique. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il espère construire sa propre boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Komla lives with his wife and his 1 year old child in Lomé. Thirty-two years old, he has been reselling general foodstuffs since 2010. Helped by 1 person, he gets his supplies in Lomé and resells to his customers in a shop. In the future, he hopes to build his own shop and meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: La Sra. Lola  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta y crianza de cerdos,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para la construcción de un espacio para sus cerdos  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos por mayor ya , se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Lola continues in the same activity raising and selling pigs. She says that the previous loan went well for her, since she used it to build a space for her pigs. At this time, she is asking for the loan to buy pigs wholesale. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mely works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Mely is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials, including nets and ropes. 

Mely has accessed fourteen loans from NWTF, which allows her to sustain her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, including nets and ropes.

loans.name: Lalekye

texts.en:
Lalekye is married, and they have four children. Lalekye has been a street vendor who sells women's, men's and children's clothing and shoes. She has been in business since 2007. Through their respective jobs, both she and her husband contribute toward household expenses in their effort to get ahead.

Lalekye is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy shirts, blouses, jeans and sport shoes for women, men and children. This will allow her to have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, jeans and sport shoes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is from the town of Kisauni. She is married and has two children, who are always with her and who help her. Beatrice has been working as a dressmaker for ten years. Her husband bought her an industrial sewing machine that she uses to make clothes in general. She also gets help from her husband, who works in order to cover family expenses and schooling costs for their children. She’s requesting this loan to buy fabric, zippers and thread, which she will use to make various items to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers and thread, which she will use to make various items of clothing

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who makes and sells boneless, dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns more income from hog raising.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more fish from which to make boneless, dried fish to sell.  The larger quantity of fish will enable her to grow her boneless dried fish vending business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish from which to make boneless, dried fish to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La Sra. Justina sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos naturales y dietéticos,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para la compra d variedad de productos para diversificar la gama de sus productos  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales y dietéticos por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Justina continues in the same activity, selling natural and dietetic products. she says that the previous loan went well for her since she used it to buy a variety of products to diversify her range of products. At this time, she is asking for the loan to buy natural and dietetic products wholesale. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she is being given to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy natural products wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and comales.

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.en:
Vitalina is a happy person and an ambitious one, who started her business through house to house service. Vitalina offers manicure and pedicure services to her customers. She also performs haircutting services for her customers. Vitalina is happy that because of her patience and hard work, she can rent a stall to perform her business.

Vitalina wishes for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy hair coloring, hair spa and wax for hair treatment. She believes that by doing this, she will encourage more customers to be served and generate income as well.

loans.use: to buy hair coloring, hair spa and wax for hair treatment.

loans.name: Tsendzesem

texts.en:
Tsendzesem is 26 years old and a widow who lives with her five-year-old daughter in an outer ger district of the city. Her mother is a trusted repeat Kiva client and she suggested to her daughter that she apply for a Kiva loan. Tsendzesem operates a retail stall at the second largest outdoor market of the city where she sells a variety of hats and caps that she imports from Ereen city. 

Tsendzesem is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase hats to sell.

loans.use: to purchase hats to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 35-year-old married man with six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For twelve years he has been running a retail shop located in a busy street. Moses also trades in coffee. He started his business for self-sustainability and to educate his children and his business challenges are bad debtors and stiff competition.

Moses is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise, such as soap and salt, to sell. In the future, his dream is to expand into new areas and trade in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Salevao

texts.en:
Salevao is a 62-year-old married woman with seven children. For the past two years, she has grown taro and banana on her small plantation. Salevao has been a member of SBPD since 2010.

Salevao is requesting a loan to purchase more tools (grass cutter, knives, and shovels) and chemicals to expand her plantation. She plans to use the profit from her loan to save for the education of her kids.

loans.use: to purchase tools and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Abednego

texts.en:
Abednego is a resident of Nkubu, in the Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. He is 28 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. He has been a farmer for five years, growing tea and selling it to Kionyo Tea Factory. Besides farming, he owns a retail shop as an extra source of income.

He requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 60,000 to be used to purchase poultry. This will help him increase his income sources further. In future, he would like to buy a car for his businesses. He faces challenges like unexpected climate changes and hence poor crop yields, and pests and diseases. He says that Juhudi Kilimo has very friendly staff.

loans.use: To pay for poultry, which will give him a new source of income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is forty-four years of age, married, and has four children, one of whom still attends school. He resides in Nkubu, Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. He has been an active farmer for nine years and sells milk, maize, bananas and beans in the local market.

He has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 40,000 to purchase irrigation equipment so that there will be a continuous supply of water to his farm, and hence a good yield. This will uplift his family's living standards. In the future he wants to expand his business and add dairy farming.

Lack of good markets for his products and pests and diseases are the main challenges he faces in his business. Alex says that Juhudi Kilimo is the best microfinance Institution for him because of its efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is from Kisauni. She is a divorced mother of six children, all of whom have graduated from school. She works selling fruits and vegetables, in a little shed at the entrance to town.

With sacrifice and dedication she managed to get her six children ahead. She is a very hardworking woman. She says she always has worked and she is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to continue growing and have a bigger shed, to continue helping her family.

Asha is coming to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva for a loan.  She will use it to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions, as well as seasonal fruits. The loan will enable her to supply her business with top-quality products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions, as well as seasonal fruits

loans.name: Jeldine

texts.en:
Jeldine is a 31-year-old, married woman, and she has one child. They reside in Nkubu, in the Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. She has been an active farmer for over ten years, growing cash crops. Besides farming, she has also set up a retail business.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 60,000. She will use the loan to purchase a chuff cutter and a zero-grazing unit. She says these purchases will improve her family's living standard. In the future she wants to be the leading dairy milk producer and increase her cows to thirty. Lack of sufficient funds and animal diseases are her major problems. She likes Juhudi Kilimo for its faster processing of loans.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter and a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a widowed mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She resides in Nkubu, in the Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. She has been a farmer for over thirty years, growing bananas and other horticultural crops. Besides farming, she also has a retail business.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 60,000, which she will use to help her purchase poultry. Due to the yields she gets from the poultry business, she will be able to pay her children's school fees. She wants to have the best poultry in the entire country. Her major challenges are:  lack of sufficient funds, crop pests, and poor markets. Consolata is congratulating Juhudi Kilimo for making her dreams come true, by financing her.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 38-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Fifteen years ago, he decided to set up a butcher shop after accessing the market in the area. He also sells hides and skins to supplement his income. The high cost of cows and transportation affect his business profits while he has visions of owning a ranch. Henry intends to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butcher shop

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is a 59-year-old married man from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. He has four grown children. He operates a variety store. He sells basic commodities such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, soaps, and toiletries. He has been in the retail business for almost nine years. He requested a loan of  PHP 6,000 to buy more commodities to sell such as rice, condiments, beverages, and soft drinks. In the future, Romeo would like to invest in other businesses to be successful, while saving for old age.

loans.use: to buy more commodities to sell such as rice, condiments, beverages, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Naimkul

texts.ru: Наимкул  родился в кишлаке, далеко от города. Его кишлак находится близко горам. Он в основном зарабатывает на жизнь своим мастерством, т.е. работает мастером на частных стройках. Также ведет домашнее хозяйство. Вместе с женой Махфиратом, они воспитывают  четырех детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Им тяжело обеспечивать детей, так как Наимкул является единственным кормильцем в семье. Наимкул в сезон строительных работ у себя в кишлаке имеет доход. Зимой в основном ухаживает за скотом. В нашу организацию обращается впервые.  Семья Наимкула живет в очень старом  доме, который сильно нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Он заготовил древесину, камни, гравий за счет дохода прошлого сезона.   Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки цемента. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Naimkul was born in the countryside, far away from the city. His village is near the mountains. He mainly earns his living with his profession, which is running private construction sites. He also runs the household. He is raising four teenaged children together with his wife Mahfiratom. It is difficult for them to provide for their kids, since Naimknul is the family's only provider. During the construction season Naimknul earns an income in the village. During the winter he mostly takes care of the livestock. He has turned to IMON for the first time. Naimknul's family lives in a very old house which badly needs major repairs. He bought lumber, stone, and gravel with last season's income. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy cement. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cement for repairing his house

loans.name: Dámaso Nelvin

texts.es: Dámaso, un hombre trabajador quien solito saca adelante a su familia, su esposa ama de casa se encarga de mantener el orden del hogar, cuida de sus hijos para su buen desarrollo, don Dámaso continua su labor como albañil de manera independiente con sus ingresos ha invertido en las mejoras de su vivienda, ahora desea continuar con la construcción de un muro perimetral que ha dado inicio una parte, continuara con lo que le hace falta, para ello necesita comprar más materiales por lo que solicita el crédito, se le facilita un poco porque no gastara en mano de obra debido a sus conocimientos de la misma, agradece a la financiera y a Kiva por el apoyo de financiamiento para poder lograr su objetivo y brindarle seguridad y comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Dámaso is a hard-working man who financially supports his family. His wife is at home and takes care of the house and the children for a good development. Don Dámaso keeps working as an independent builder and, with the income he earns, he has made improvements to his house. He's now willing to continue with the construction of a perimeter wall and needs to buy additional materials, which is why he's requesting a loan. He doesn't need much though because he won't spend in labor cost. He's grateful to the financial institution and to Kiva for the financial support they give him to reach his goal and to provide safety and comfort to his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and blocks.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is 37 years old, married, and already has two children: a six-year-old daughter and a two-year-old son. His daughter goes to preschool. He wants his daughter to become a teacher of history and mathematics. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income.

Parviz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border.

This is Parviz's second loan from Kiva. He started his new business two years ago to raise cattle to sell milk.

Now Parviz needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy calves to increase the amount of dairy products to sell at local bazaars and markets. He wants to use the money from his new business to help his family. In the future, Parviz wants to have a big farm for calves. This will be more profitable for his business. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to increase sales

loans.name: Mirzoabdullo

texts.ru:
Мирзоабдулло трудолюбивый и добрый мужчина.  Он женат и воспитывает четверых детей.  Мирзоабдулло хороший семьянин.  Его жена домохозяйка, воспитывает детей.    Около 10 лет  Мирзоабдулло   занимается  сельскохозяйственной продукцией. В  основном выращивает персик и абрикос. 
Мирзоабдулло  также откармливает и перепродает скот.  Этим делом он тоже занимается более 8 лет.  То этого вида деятельности Мирзоабдулло получает очень хорошую прибыль.   В бизнесе помогают  жена и дети.  Он имеет дома несколько коров и овец, кроме того, он продает их шерсть. 

На данный момент  Мирзоабдулло запрашивает кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Он планирует расширить свой бизнес по откорму скота и надеется на финансовую поддержку от организации Кива, и заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en:
Mirzoabdullo is a hardworking and kind man.  He is married, raising four children, and is a very good family man.  His wife is a homemaker: she takes care of the children.

Mirzoabdullo has been involved in farming for almost ten years.  He essentially grows peaches and apricots.  

Mirzoabdullo also fattens and resells cattle, and has been involved in this activity for more than eight years.  He makes good profits from this activity.  His wife and children help him with his business.  He owns a few cows and sheep which he keeps at home, and he sells his sheep's wool.

Mirzoabdullo is currently requesting a loan to increase his livestock headcount.  He plans to expand his animal fattening business and hopes to receive some financial support from Kiva, which he thanks in advance for its assistance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Чамшед молодой мужчина в возрасте 25 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей.  Более десяти лет занимается откормом скота.  Этому делу Чамшед научился у своего отца, с самого детства он стоял рядом с отцом и наблюдал как он откармливает скот. Теперь это занятие стало его доходом.   Дополнительно Чамшед выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру. Он имеет не большой участок земли. Но основной доход у Чамшеда от откорма скота.  Жена в свободное время помогает ему присматривать скот. 
На данный момент Чамшед нуждается в корме для скота,так как пока в горах травы мало ему необходимо приобрести  корм для скота. Чамшед решил подать заявку на кредит и обратился в организацию Арванд. 
На полученный кредит он хочет купить корм для скота.  Он надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Chamshed is a young man of 25. He is married and has two children. He has been raising cattle for more than ten years. Chamshed learned this line of work from his father, whom he stood next to from an early age and observed how to feed cattle. Now this occupation has become his livelihood. Chamshed also does some farming; he has a small plot of land. But his primary source of income is from raising cattle. His wife helps him take care of the cattle in her free time.

Right now Chamshed needs feed for the animals, for there is little grass in the mountains. Chamshed decided to apply for a loan, and came to Arvand. He wants to use the livestock feed. He is counting on your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been a member of VEP's Kamwangi Group since 2008 and has benefited immensely from the group savings accounts and group loans. He comes from Kamwangi center in Thika District, and his main source of livelihood is farming.

All his children are grown and married. He and his wife live with one of their sons within one compound.

James has four cows and eight goats. From the cows he is able to get at least 12 liters of milk, which he sells at about $0.50 per liter. He shares this income with his son to help pay the school fees for his three grandchildren. 

James would like a Kiva loan to construct a biodigester, which will help him save on fuel costs. Every day he spends a tleast $0.50 to buy kerosene for cooking, but biogas will provide a direct source of clean gas from his farm. His wife, daughter in-law, and grandchildren also suffer from walking long distances to fetch firewood every weekend for cooking, and this task reduces the children's study time and play time.

He will be able to repay the loan from his fuel savings, income from his dairy cows, and the fruits and vegetables that he will grow using the organic bioslurry, another by-product of the biodigester.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester

loans.name: Erazimas

texts.en: Erazimas is a 37-year-old, hardworking man, who has six children and lives in Masindi, in Uganda.The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him alone, and his desire is to educate his children up to the University level. He practices farming. He has got an ox to help him in farming with ease, and he also hires it out to other farmers. Unpredictable weather changes and limited capital affect his growth. His dream is to become a model farmer in the region. Erazimas intends to use the loan to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: to buy more land for farming.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother and has eight children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer, and he helps her with her expenses.

Margaret is a very selfless lady. She started out working as a domestic employee in private homes, so that she could earn her income. Later, with the money she earned, she set up a small grocery store where her husband helps her out. Thanks to her work and efforts, she has been able to provide her children with all the comforts they needed and an education.

Margaret is requesting this loan to buy essentials to resell at her store, such as flour, noodles, rice, and oil. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy essentials to resell at her grocery store, such as flour, noodles, rice, and oil

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn, 40, is married and has three dependent children, two schoolchildren and one little kid. She and the rest of her family are living in a village located in the Samrong district of Takeo province, where silk weaving is the popular business in which to make a living. Like her neighbors, Sokhoeurn is also a silk weaver. She also owns another business, rice cropping. The 20 years' involvement in the current business has returned her about 13,000 KHR per day and she saves about 3,700 KHR each day after offsetting the necessary living expenses.

Sokhoeurn is on her seventh loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels confident that she can stabilize her business and provide the three times daily, decent meal for her family. For this loan, she forms a group of three to apply for the amount of 600,000 KHR, each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that this purchase will promote a good health practice for her kids.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 32 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Masindi. Uganda. He is a carpenter who is gifted with art but also trades in agricultural produce for additional income.

Alex is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy produce such as maize to sell. Customers not paying on time and inadequate capital affect his businesses. He dreams of educating his children up to the university level and owning a food store and a workshop in town.

loans.use: to purchase produce such as maize to sell.

loans.name: Juraboy

texts.ru:
Чурабой проживает в селе,  неподалеку от города. Он не женат, проживает в одном доме с родителями. В 2010 году закончил школу. В связи с нехваткой финансов он никуда не поступил, хотя окончил школу хорошо. Родители Чурабоя испытывают трудности в финансовом плане, так как семья большая. Всех нужно поднять на ноги. Уже год как  он занимается купле-продажей  мужской одежды. Одежду он закупает в другом городе по оптовой цене.   По началу Чурабой испытывал трудности , так как не было опыта работы в бизнесе.  Он надеется что пройдет все трудности и самостоятельно встанет на ноги.  Как у всех людей у Чуравбоя  есть свои цели. Он хочет накопить денег и поступить в Вуз.  В будущем мечтает работать по специальности. Но по мимо своих целей Чурабой должен помогать свой семье. 
По совету родственников он обратился в МДО « Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит он хочет купить ассортимент мужской одежды и  увеличить свой товарооборот. Он очень благодарен организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Juraboy lives in a village not far from a city.  He's single and lives with his parents.  In 2010, he finished high school but because of financial limitations, he did not continue into higher education even though he finished school strongly.  Juraboy's parents are experiencing financial hardship because of their large family.  His parents need to get everyone on their feet.  Juraboy has been working in trade, selling men's clothing, for a year.  He buys his clothing in another city at low prices.  In the beginning, things were difficult because he didn't have any previous, relevant experience.  He hopes to overcome all obstacles and become self-reliant. Juraboy has goals, just like everyone does.  He wants to save money and study at university.  He wants to be able to work in a specialized field.  However, helping his family comes first.  

Relatives recommended he take out a loan from Arvand.  With these funds, he wants to buy an assortment of men's clothing to increase turnover.  He is very grateful to Arvand for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of men's clothing

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is married and has children.  He is a very hardworking man, living in Kisauni.  Anthony has been a moto taxi driver for five years. 

Anthony is requesting a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust, which he will use to buy spare parts for his moto taxi so that he will be able to keep on working and offering a good service to his customers at the same time. His job is demanding but he likes it because through this job he can support his wife and his children. He dreams of buying another taxi stand and another moto taxi to work with in order to progress a little more every day.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his moto taxi.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 34, is a hardworking lady. She is married with three children aged between one and seven years. The family lives in a rural area near Kampala.

Imelda has a food stall by the roadside on a highway. She works twelve hours a day selling plantains to people living in the area. She also rears pigs to supplement her income. Her business is challenged by competing vendors, price fluctuations and dry weather that affects the growth of her fruit.

Imelda is applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy additional plantains to sell. Her desire is to continue meeting her family’s basic needs adequately and send her children to a relatively good school.

loans.use: to buy additional plantains to sell.

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza lives with her partner in Kisauni. They both work in retail trade. Medza has a well-stocked store selling vegetables, fruit, consumer staples, drinks, and dairy products. 

Medza is requesting a loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust, which she will use to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, etc. She is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy camote, bananas, sugar, milk, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo es una persona  trabajadora y responsable, teniendo como actividad venta de artículos escolares y fotocopia, ubicada en su casa de habitación en la capital. atiende su negocio junto a sus hijos.

 Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para comprar una copiadora que le permita sacar fotocopias más rápidas,  Esto con el propósito de dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  El crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar más insumos para su negocio.

Se siente agradecida con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en el, por medio de los préstamos ha incrementado su negocio y le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia. él ha repagado muy bien sus créditos.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a hard-working and responsible man who makes a living from selling school supplies and photocopies. His business is located in his house in the capital and he takes care of it with his children. 

He's requesting a loan to Ceprodel to buy a copying machine that will allow him to make copies faster and to provide a better service to his clients. He used his last loan to buy supplies for his business. 

He's grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and trustworthiness shown towards him. Thanks to the loans, he's grown his business, made improvements to his home and improved his quality of life and that of his family. He has repaid his past loans without issues.

loans.use: to improve his business.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
A 60-year-old mother of five children living in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Soeun strives to make a living by working in a garment factory. She has been doing so for two years, earning about 4 USD a day.

This is not the first loan for Soeun with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She repaid her past loan by living wisely. She is now applying for a 300 USD loan in order to buy a decent motorbike for commuting. With her own bike she can reduce her transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a 38-year-old, married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 19 and the youngest is 9 years old. She engages in a fishing business. She has been in this business for 20 years. This is the source of her income.

Rosalyn is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fishing net, lead sinkers, and floaters. These materials are very useful in fishing. By the help of this loan, she will be able to buy these materials so she can have better fishing. Rosalyn hopes to expand her business in the future. She also hopes that all her children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, lead sinkers, and floaters

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 53 years old, married and has four children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is a very enterprising man, who started up a school and also practices farming. Like most farmers, he is challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuations. His dreams are seeing his children graduate with degrees and venturing into mechanized agriculture. Wilson intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs and to pay workers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay workers

loans.name: Margaret Waithira

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother living in Makomboki, Muranga county in Central Kenya. She is a mother of four, two of whom are in high school and two in college. She is a farmer who raises six dairy cows and also harvests bananas, which she sells in the market.

Margaret currently uses both firewood and charcoal for cooking, and every month she buys a sack of charcoal at $14 per bag. She also buys kerosene for lighting for $0.50 per day. This is a huge expense for her, and she would greatly benefit from a biodigester, which would allow her to generate significant savings over time. She would like to divert these savings to educate all her children through college.

She would like a Kiva loan to construct a biodigester, which she will repay in installments through her savings and loan group. With the biogas she will have enough fuel for cooking and lighting. She will use the money saved on fuel, along with the profit from the sale of milk and bananas, to repay this loan.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Savun's Group

texts.en:
A married mother with eleven children, Savun is 55 years old and lives in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. For the past 35 years she and her husband have worked to alleviate the family’s hardships by growing rubber trees. She also works for pay at a rubber tree plantation, earning about 28,700 KHR a day.

Savun and her group of five members are applying for a 5,000,000 KHR loan through VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As the group leader, she will use her portion of the loan to buy a decent motorbike to help in her work. She hopes that she can make more money so she can build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to help in her work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Poverty Eradication Group

texts.en: Shawari is a hard-working mother of four, and she also takes care of her late brother's children. She devotes 13 hours a day to her charcoal business in the city's outskirts. She hopes that the increased profit from the loan will help her to expand the business. And, with the increased income, she hopes to adequately meet her family's needs. She is a hard-working woman. She attributes her success to the group cohesion, and the financing from Ugafode and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more stock of charcoal to resell at her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers for ploughing services and to buy seeds

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu travels to Mombasa and brings back articles of clothing, which allows her to continue offering good prices. The articles of clothing that she sells most are those for women and children, such as blouses, t-shirts, shorts, sweatshirts, and lingerie. She is requesting assistance so that she can buy articles of clothing that are in season. Mbeyu wants to be well-stocked with these items so that she can offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell, that are in season

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional livestock and vaccines, for her livestock-raising business.

Miraflor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and vaccines for her business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 44 years old and a local villager from Takeo province. To deal with the daily cost of living, she farms rice on a total of five hectares of farmland. She has been a farmer for twenty years.

Sopheap has taken out three loans through VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has managed her past loans effectively enough to be able to both support her farming and set aside some money for her children. Now she is applying for a 1600 USD education loan to pay for her children’s tuition.

Sopheap hopes to provide financial support for her children so they can get good educations and find good jobs to help support the entire family.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s tuition.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly, a 44-year-old married mother of three children currently in school, works very hard to provide for them. She has run a general store in the Philippines for three years, selling a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, coffee, noodles and other groceries.

Nelly has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more of the above items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to allow her children to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, sugar, coffee, noodles and other groceries in her general store.

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sarah Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Sarah Jean is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle for her tricycle transport business.

Sarah Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz used his previous loan to buy spare motorcycle parts to sell.  He is a 41-year-old, married man with eight children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been dealing in spare parts for a period of eleven years. He earned the capital to start his repair business by working as a motorcycle cyclist. Inadequate capital is the adverse factor most affecting his business. 

Aziz would like to build a permanent home and hire employees to help expand his business while his personal goal is to give a hands-on training to his children as a business continuity strategy.  Aziz intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Virginia has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her tricycle.

Virginia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is 33 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having an ornamental vending business in the Philippines. Cherry Mae is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like flower pots and flower fertilizers for her business.

Cherry Mae has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from black-smithing and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like flower pots and flower fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers operates a bar in Kyebanda Kisalosalo, a city suburb.  With his wife, he works with a supreme security company as a site manager.

He is a repeat client and he is applying for a second loan of UGX 600,000 to add stock to his bar business so as to increase his profits and get more income to expand his business.  This will help him earn enough money to pay school fees for his child and build a house for his family.  His good customer relations have increased the number of customers to his bar. He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the bar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is from Kisauni, lives in her own home and has one child. She has a business selling seasonal fruits and vegetables in an itinerant manner. She makes deliveries to homes, house by house, because she has an established customer base.

Elizabeth has been covering the educational expenses for her child with a lot of effort by selling tomatoes, lettuce, onions and fruit. She comments that her work requires a lot of sacrifice, because it's not easy to go out into the streets to sell. Her goal is to have her child become a good and well-educated person who will not have to suffer the hardships that she has experienced.

Elizabeth approached Yehu Microfinance to ask for a small loan that will help her to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva for this great assistance that they are providing, as the loan is going to be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
For the last three years Lida, who is 48 years old and married with one child, has been earning a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Now borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell, Lida is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena works hard to support her family. Ma. Magdalena is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Magdalena has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft-drinks, sugar, laundry soap, soy sauce and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Magdalena has been in this business for four years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Ma. Magdalena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft-drinks, sugar, laundry soap, soy sauce and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Doña Faustina, tiene 49 años de edad, vive sola en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisas, pantalones cortos y otros. El negocio lo ha establecido en un mercado local donde alquila. Ha decidido solicitar un quinto préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 12,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar más ropa variada como camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas y otros, y mantener su negocio en crecimiento. Su meta es seguir creciendo y superarse económicamente.
texts.en: Faustina is 49 years old and lives alone in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  She has been selling clothing, such as blouses, pants, shirt, shorts, and other things for ten years.  She set up the business in the market where she rents a space.  She’s decided to request this loan though ODEF, in the amount of 12,000 Lempiras, which she will use to buy various types of clothing such as shirts, blouses, skirts, and other things, and continue growing her business.  Her goal is to continue growing and succeed financially.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Douglas Mauricio

texts.es:
Douglas es un señor Dinámico para las actividades comerciales, junto a su esposa manejan diversidad de tipos de negocio como: librería, venta de recargas, Cyber,  Fotocopias y venta de Ropa Usada. Es casado con 2 hijos a su cargo, a los que le está brindando la ayuda necesaria para su desarrollo académico.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de una fotocopiadora de mayor capacidad y poder cubrir la demanda existente debido a esto visito las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito, para poder lograr el objetivo percibido y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y de la vida familia. 

Agradeciéndole de antemano a  ceprodel y a los inversionistas de kiva por lo oportuno de crédito y por el apoyo que le brindan a estos sectores que tanto necesitan para poder desarrollar.
texts.en:
Douglas is a dynamic man for commercial activities.  Together with his wife, he manages a variety of businesses, such as a bookstore, phone card sales, an internet café, photocopies and used clothing sales.  He is married with two children in his care, to whom he is providing the help necessary for their academic development.
