Currently, he is in need of financing which he will use to buy a photocopier with more capacity and power to meet the existing demand.  Due to this, he visited the offices of CEPRODELl to apply for a loan in order to be able to reach his perceived objective and, in this way, to better the living conditions of his family.  

He thanks CEPRODEL and the Kiva investors in advance for the opportunity to obtain the loan and for the support that they provide to these sectors that so need it to develop.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Bolorsaikhan

texts.en:
Bolorsaikhan, 35, is married, has two children and lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. The family lives in Ulaanbaatar’s outer ger district, which lacks the basic infrastructure found in the city.

Bolorsaikhan helps support her family by operating a cosmetics shop while her husband works at a private company. Both of her children attend secondary school. She is a very astute person who knows in what season what kind of cosmetics ladies want to buy.

Bolorsaikhan is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan through Transcapital to buy more cosmetics for the upcoming season. She knows this is when most women shop for cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Her children are all in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising hogs in the Philippines. She has been in hog raising for five years.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Maria Cristina and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business activity. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 36-year-old, married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a secondary school teacher, but he also started a produce business after realizing that the meager salary he earns on a monthly basis can hardly meet his family's basic needs.

Inadequate capital is his major challenge. His dreams are building a permanent house for his family and owning a food store that can supply his customers all year round. Bernard intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to resell to his customers

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: From Solinog, Calamba, Dionesia is 54 years, married and blessed with five children. For the past 12 years she has been selling fish to make a living. A member of Paglaum MPC for almost six years, Dionesia has requested this loan to pay for a permit and another business license.

loans.use: To pay for a permit and another business license.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia, who is married and has a general store business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In this business for 10 years now, she has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks such as biscuits, noodles, bread, canned goods, etc. to sell in her store.

Mauricia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like biscuits, noodles, bread, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Mary works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs and chickens.

Mary is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like breads, shampoo, coffee and other groceries. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like breads, shampoo, coffee, and other groceries

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto tiene 32 años de edad, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, debido a que es el mayor de sus hermanos varones, por lo que tenia que ayudar a su padre para llevar el alimento a su hogar. A los 18 años de edad, se caso y empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, cultivando de 14,000 a 28,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y trabajando como jornal para que a su familia no le faltara nada. 

Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a cuatro kilómetros de su casa; luego tiene que pagar un vehiculo particular para que le traslade los insumos hasta su casa, después contrata a una persona que posee carreta para llevarlos gasta el lugar en donde tiene sus cultivos que esta ubicado a un kilómetro de la casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, semillas, fertilizantes y preparar la tierra para sembrar. De esta manera, podrá obtener una buena cosecha para vender y la otra parte para consumo familiar y poder construir una casa para que sus hijos vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 32 years old, married, and has four children.  He has been a farmer since he was very young because he was the oldest brother and needed to help his father feed the family.  He married at age 18 and began working on his own, working between 14,000 and 28,000 square meters of corn and working as a field hand so that his family needs for nothing.

He buys his farming supplies at a town located four kiometers from his home, then he has to pau for a private vehicle to transport the supplies to his home.  Then he gets in touch with a person with a cart in order to transport the supplies to the place where his crops are, one kilometer from his home.

He will use the money from the loan through Fundación Campo to buy compost, seed, and fertilizers and prepare the land for planting.  In this way he can obtain a good harvest to sell part of it and retain part of it for his family’s consumption and to be able to build a house so that his children can have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Waggwa

texts.en:
Waggwa is an electronics technician on the city's outskirts. He repairs radios, televisions, and DVD players. Waggwa has an additional income from rentals. To earn a living, he started his workshop ten years ago. He has been able to build a house with rental income from business. 

He is applying for a UGX 500,000/= loan to pay tuition for his two children. He will be able to pay back using income from the electronics repairs. He is a hard-working and focused man.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a single mother of two children, ages 9 and 15 years. They live at their own house, which has electricity but not piped water.

Cecilia sells beverages of all types, such as beer, soda, wine, and other products. She has a store in her home, which is next to town. Cecilia is well-known in her neighborhood for providing good service and her friendliness. She says that her store generates a good income, especially on the weekends when most of her customers visit. For this reason, she wants to continue investing in her business.

The loan she requested will be used to buy beverages, such as beer, whiskey, and others, so that she can restock her business and satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, such as beer, whiskey, soda, and others

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old and from Migori county. He is married to Caroline, who is a business lady. They have four children, who are 13, 10, 7 and 4 years old.

John operates a pharmacy, which has been running for 11 years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more medicines for his shop. He will use the anticipated profit to change his living standard and that of his family. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

He has a plan of using his business to reduce the level of poverty in his home and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines from the supplier

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To repair the rickshaw, and buy a new body for the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Ma. Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal and firewood vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Nida is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal and firewood vending business.

Ma. Nida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en: Kaingu is the very model of a hard-working and enterprising young man. He greatly values the support that our institution has offered him with this loan, and he assures us that he will always be a good client. He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and accessories for his motorbike.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for his motorbike.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a thirty-one-year-old, married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  Since 2003 he has been farming and also trades in produce since his farm outputs are not enough for vast markets.  With the proceeds he has been able to pay the school fees for his children and buy more land for farming.  

Like most farmers Jimmy has challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital, while his dreams are to build a permanent residential house and venture into mechanized agriculture.  Jimmy intends to use the loan to buy maize, groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 32 years old. She lives in the Chiatura district with her ten-year-old son. Sopio had requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time  because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly salary earned by Sopio as a sales lady at a flower shop. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Sopio requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program envisages provision of business start ups and re-startups with credits for soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Sopio will open her own flower shop. As she is experienced in this field, she hopes the business will be profitable and she will be able to increase her income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a flower shop.

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en:
Pamella is 34 years old and from Migori county. She is married to Tobias, who is a businessman, and she has been blessed with two children. They are eleven and seven years old. 

She has a posho mill, and she has been operating it for six years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000 using the mill. She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for her posho mill and repair it. She will use the anticipated profit to purchase goods to sell, like maize and beans. She has hopes of becoming a successful businesswoman in her location, and also of supporting her extended family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her posho mill and to repair it

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a 21-year-old single woman, who has been working in selling children's toys since 2010. Her business is going on just fine, but she needs an additional external support to make sure that everything requested is available. Reem is well-known in her region, for the special customer care she provides, which starts with a beautiful smile on her face, welcoming everyone passing by.

Reem is a hardworking woman, she puts in much effort to develop herself and her business. In addition to her toy selling shop she works as a tutor. She is an education provider, and she enjoys it. Tutoring is an additional income business, which she does at her shop.

Reem is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. She will invest it in increasing her business merchandise with special summer toys (inflatable beach toys and a lot more). She will also prepare herself for her engagement, with small things she might need. She hopes to expand her business more and more, through opening a larger shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy special summer toys and beach needs

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 23 years old and married.  She is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Shirly has been in this business for four years. Shirly earns more income from farming peanuts and raising livestock.

Shirly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants, and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 40 years old and from Migori town; she is married to Peter, a businessman, and she is blessed with five children who are 18, 15, 13, 10 and 5. 

She is a fish monger, a business she has been doing for seven years.  She comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 10,000, and she is taking her fifth loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell, and she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

She has a dream of becoming a successful business lady in her community by just selling fish, and also providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is a hardworking man living in Baculud with his parents. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell; he had been in the farming business for more than five years. His income of PHP 20,000 twice a year,during harvest, goes for meals, revolving capital in the business, and other bills at home. 

He hopes to keep nourishing his crops to attain a plentiful harvest, which is why he is now borrowing PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Erwin hopes to keep improving his farming business to achieve a bountiful harvest that will help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Mwangolo

texts.en:
Mwangolo is from Kisauni and has children. He reports that he is the owner and operator of a small grocery store. Additionally, his wife sells fast food, so together, they are able to support their children.

He is a very hard-working, responsible, and honest man. He always dreamed of having a well-stocked store in order to better support his family. Now he has his own business, with an established customer base and a good income.

Mwangolo is seeking this loan in order to buy rice, noodles, milk, beverages, and other items. This will enable him to continue to offer a good variety of items to his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, milk, beverages, and other items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 63 years old. She lives in Tkibuli District with her husband. Several times, Mariam requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Each time, her loan request was rejected because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a monthly pension of Mariam and her husband. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Mariam requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Mariam will begin to trade with used clothing. She will purchase used clothing at wholesale prices and then resell the items among her villagers. She had worked in this sphere and is experienced and hopes that it will be profitable. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin to trade with used clothing.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Elsie has been in this business for 57 years. Elsie earns more income from buy and sell charcoal and fire wood.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food vending business and sustain the buy and sell charcoal and fire wood.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nupi Lom Group

texts.en:
Heneo is 45 years old and belongs to Nupi Lom SHG group. Heneo is the featured borrower member with her hand raised. The literal meaning of “Nupi Lom” is women’s group. Nupi-Lom group comprises nine hardworking and determined women.

Heneo sells yarn in a shop which is located in the main district market. She started her business when she availed a loan for the first time from WSDS, and she is still continuing it. She gets the yarn supplies from the main market in the city and sells them in the town market. 

Heneo is doing great in her business. She supplies yarns to all the weavers in the village and close-by villages. With the gradual progress in her business, she is now able to refill her shop with various yarn and also stocks woven products like traditional women’s wrap skirts and men’s shawls. She also provides credit facilities for acquainted weavers and gets repaid later by the weavers. 

Heneo is planning to purchase more yarn for her shop with the Kiva loan. She wishes to refill her stock in the shop and is planning to make savings for the future. She is determined to let her children get the best education and is grooming them to be successful persons. Her only dream is to see her children successful in the days to come; with that hope, she is working with her heart and soul to make her dreams come true.

The other Nupi Lom group members are engaged in piggery, poultry, paan shop, and weaving. They are true to their words and believe in their dreams. They wish all the lenders a good life and prosperous years ahead. They say, "Thank you, Kiva."

loans.use: to purchase more yarn for sale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is from Kisauni, he drives a motorcycle taxi. He is single and has worked as a taxi driver for four years. He used to live with his parents and decided to come to live in town, thinking of his own progress and that of his family.

He remarks that his job is very difficult because during the rainy season he has a lot of obstacles since he has had fewer passengers since it's cold. His dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus progress more every day.

He is asking for this loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 38-year-old woman from Migori. She is married to Samuel; they have four children, ages 12,10, 6 and 2, respectively.

Beatrice is in the business of selling second-hand bags, a business she has done for the past 13 years, earning a monthly income of KES 26,000. 

She has borrowed her fifth loan of KES 60,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) and she intends to use this amount to purchase sacks of used handbags to sell. 

The profit earned will be used to pay school fees and to repay her loan. Beatrice's dream is to build her own house and to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of handbags to sell.

loans.name: Lucia Zelmira

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Zelmira, es  Madre soltera de dos  hijos y se desempeña como profesora docente de unos de los colegios de la ciudad de león desde hace 13 años dando el pan del saber a sus alumnos realiza esta labor de lunes a viernes con horario 7:00 am  y finaliza a las 1:00 pm.   Ella  hace este tipo de trabajo para llevar  el sustento de su familia.

Doña Lucia solicita un crédito para compra de material de construcción tales como arena, cemento, hierro, bloque, zinc,  perlines, para realizarle mejora a su humilde vivienda ya que se aproxima la temporada de invierno,  y así tener un mejor nivel de vida de ella y sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia Zelmira is a single mother of two children.

She has worked as a teacher for 13 years in one of the schools in the city of León, giving students the bread of knowledge.  She works Monday through Friday from 7 a.m. until 1 p.m.  She does this type of work to support her family.

Lucia's requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, rebar, cinder blocks, metal roofing, and gravel to make improvements on her modest house because winter is approaching.  This way she and her two children will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, rebar, cinder blocks, metal roofing, and gravel

loans.name: Marlyn Massiel

texts.es:
Marlyn, una humilde joven con deseo de superación, de 22 años de edad, originaria de León, soltero, madre de 1 hijo de 6 años, actualmente estudia, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 6 años, solo logro finalizar su cuarto año de secundaria.
Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de un pequeño préstamo que le dieron las instituciones financieras, fue asi que ella empezó a trabajar en su propio negocio vendiendo ropa de forma ambulante, con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo sale todos los días por las calles a vender su ropa, es asi como ella se gana la vida. 
 Ella   a pesar de que es una joven siempre ha sido una mujer independiente, la cual ha sabido ganarse la vida trabajando duramente, cuenta con el apoyo de su mama quien le ayuda  a vender su ropa, sus expectativas es ampliar  su negocio con el objetivo de incrementar las ventas cada  día.
Esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar ropa interior, blusas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, short, calcetines, etc. Dentro de sus planes futuros es poder establecer una tienda solo de ropa para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marlyn is a humble young woman of 22 with the desire to forge ahead. She originally came from Leon, is single, and the mother of a 6 year old son. Marlyn only managed to complete her 4th year of secondary school.

She began her business with the aid of a small loan she received from financial institutions. That is how Marlyn came to work in her own business selling clothing in the streets. With great effort and arduous labor, she ventures out every day into the streets to sell her clothes. This is how she earns a living.  
 
Despite being so young, Marlyn has always been an independent woman, and has learned how to earn her living by working hard. Marlyn can count on her mother's help in selling clothes. Her expectations are to expand her business with the object of increasing sales each day.

Marlyn is requesting financing to buy underwear, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, shorts, socks, etc. Among her future plans is to be able to establish a clothing store in order to acquire more earnings.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, shorts, socks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 63-year-old retired woman. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with her husband and son. Tina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tina has rented commercial space inside the big local market. She is baking pastries, and bringing them out and selling them to get a small daily income. Her husband is working as a security guard on a small salary. The family’s total income is rarely enough for food and covering the household expenses.  

Tina requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Tina will purchase a draft beer machine, flour and sausages to have more variety of food. As the summer season is coming soon, Tina hopes that beer will be highly requested and her business will be successful. She also wants to bake more food to give a better choice to her clients. This will help Tina to earn a good profit. She will use part of the profit for reinvesting and purchasing more products and another part for covering her family’s monthly expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a draft beer machine, flour and sausages.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. She also earns income from farming sugarcane and hiring out trucks.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business further and sustain her sugarcane farming and truck rental businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 36-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda. In 2007 he decided to start a piggery after realizing that the meager salary he earns as a primary school teacher could hardly meet his family's daily needs. One of his challenges is the high cost of feed, and his dreams are to diversify his business to include pineapple farming and also expand his piggery project. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy pig feed and pineapple seedlings.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pineapples seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis says that there are several taxis in this zone and that business is very competitive. He cannot miss his shift for even one day--not even if it is raining or cold. His greatest desire is that his children are able to become good people. That way he will be able to fulfill his obligation as a father. He is requesting this loan to buy replacement parts to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Lelianita

texts.en: Lelianita is 46 years old and married. She has two children, who are in school. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lelianita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and buy fertilizers for her farm. Lelianita has been farming sugarcane for nine years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now asking for a new loan to further build her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pays for laborers' salaries and buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Romeo Sr.

texts.en: Romeo, a widowed 53-year-old father of five, lives in Landing, Baliangao where he has been growing rice for 10 years. A member of PMPC for a year, Romeo has requested a loan to purchase a hand tractor power tiller.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor tiller.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, breads, milk, sugar and beverages

loans.name: Nelly Del Transito

texts.es:
La señora Nelly es casada y con 1 hija la cual es estudiante universitaria en donde cursa el segundo año, Doña Nelly es trabajadora activa y labora para una institución financiera desde hace 6 años, desempeñándose como conserje.

Ella habita en un reparto desde hace 7 años, su mayor anhelo es realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda y poder tener mejores condiciones en su hogar, ademas de continuar apoyando a su hija en la universidad para que concluya sus estudios. por ese motivo solicita un crédito para solventar gastos de la universidad para que su hija no tenga ningún inconveniente con seguir adelante en su formación.
texts.en:
Nelly is married and has one daughter, who's in her second year of university study.  Nelly is hardworking and active, and she has worked for a financial institution as a janitor for six years.

She has lived in a housing development for seven years.  Her biggest desire is to make some improvements to her house and be able to have better living conditions there.

She also wants to continue supporting her daughter in the university so she finishes her studies.  This is why she's requesting a loan to pay her daughter's university expenses so she doesn't have any problem making progress in her academic preparation.

loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy school supplies

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She has four children.

For ten years now, Scovia has been selling electronics. She used her personal savings to start the business. Inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand is her main challenge. Her dreams are to educate her children up to the university and to diversify her business to include solar supplies. 

Scovia intends to use the loan to buy electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell.

loans.name: Diana Atieno

texts.en:
Diana is 37 years old and sells second-hand clothes. The business is doing well and she makes a monthly income of KES 35,000.

Diana has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes for sale. 

She will use her profits to pay school fees for her children. She still has a dream of owning a boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Bijuma

texts.en:
Bijuma is from Kisauni. She is married and her husband is a businessman. Together they have three children who all attend school and are dependent on her.

Bijuma has a store in her home with a well-established customer base. She is very hardworking and an excellent client of Yehu Microfinance. Her husband has a retail shop and the two of them help each other so that they can get ahead and so that they are able to raise their children. Bijuma is requesting this loan to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, flour, rice and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Ramziya

texts.en:
Ramziya is a 25-year-old single woman who has been working as a tutor for seven years. She is well known in her region with the special care she shows her students and her interest in providing them with the best she can offer.
Ramziya works from home and she wants to improve her working space. That's why she applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to make necessary repairs to the room she is working in and to buy a kitchen set that she needs.
Ramziya is hoping to open a special education center in the future and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen set and make necessary repairs to her room used for tutoring.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura, a widow, works hard to support her family through her tailoring business in the Philippines.

Laura requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Laura has been in this business for 12 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her tailoring business.

In the future, Laura would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Silvia Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es casada y con 4 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos es independiente y trabaja por cuenta propia. Ella cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitación la cual tiene establecida desde hace 9 años, comenta que inicio con dinero propio y que ahora en su negocio vende todo tipo de productos lo que hace que su clientela le sea fiel.

El crédito que solicita le permitirá  invertir en mas productos y de esta forma su negocio crecerá.
Ella tiene como objetivo ampliar aun mas su negocio invirtiendo en ropa de niños, ropa interior, blusas y pantalones, ya que en su localidad es el único negocio fuerte que existe y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a married woman and has four children, one of whom is independent and works on his own. She owns a store and has been running it in her home for 9 years. She started with her own money and now sells all kind of products for her loyal clientele. 

She's requesting a loan to invest in more products and to grow her business. Her goal is to grow by investing in kids' clothing, underwear, blouses and pants. Hers is the only strong business in the city and this investment will allow her to improve her income and provide her children with better life conditions.

loans.use: to invest in her business by purchasing kids' clothing, blouses, ankle supports and underwear.

loans.name: Fidelina Petrona

texts.es:
Doña Fidelina una humilde señora de 59 años de edad, soltera, madre de 2 hijos de 13 y 33 años, actualmente solo uno estudia y el otro trabaja, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender cosméticos.
Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 39 años, con ayuda de una amiga que le dio a idea de que se afiliara a la línea de perfumes de la Avon y zermat, fue asi que ella  comenzó a vender perfumes de la zermat  y Avon, ella esta muy satisfecha  porque este negocio le genera ganancias a diarios, sus cosméticos los  distribuyen en las empresas y  colegios, cuenta con clientes fijos, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su mama, recibe otros ingresos como es el salario que gana como Docente de un colegio.
Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar perfumes variados. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar perfumes de otra marca con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientela, uno de sus planes futuro es poder establecer  otro negocio solo de ropa, sus metas próximas es poder ampliar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Fidelina is a humble woman of 59 years of age. She is single and has two children who are 13 and 33 years of age. Only one of her children is studying and the other is working as a salesperson, selling cosmetics. 

Fidelina started working in sales  when she was 39 years old, with the help of a friend who gave the idea to join the Avon and Zermat line of perfumes and this is how she started to sell Avon and Zermat perfumes.

She is very happy because this business generates daily income. Her cosmetics are distributed in shops and she has regular customers. Her mother supports her in her business, and she receives further income from the salary she earns as a school teacher.  

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of perfumes. She estimates that the loan will help her to buy perfumes of a different brand with the aim of growing her business and satisfying demand. One of her future plans is to establish another business selling just clothes. Her short-term goal is to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 42 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace unos 10 años se dedica a prestar sus servicios  en el mercado de la ciudad, específicamente en los servicios sanitarios ya que estos le son arrendados por la alcaldía municipal, él solo paga los impuestos municipales del arrendamiento, agua, luz y otros derechos.
Él se encarga de que los servicios sanitarios que estén en perfectas condiciones como, la limpieza, el orden, la seguridad entre otros. 

El señor compra los artículos de limpieza en supermercados y tiendas aledañas a su negocio como también a proveedores que venden por mayorista estos le dejan al crédito para un plazo de quince días. Él quiere contar con un fondo que le permita comprar estos artículos a otros proveedores que con el dinero en mano (efectivo) le venden a mejor precio 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 50 fardos de papel higiénico, 25 quintales de papel diario, 5   docenas de jabón para manos, 5   docenas de desinfectante para piso, 5   trapeadores, Pago de un año de impuestos a la alcaldía y una carretada de leña. Etc.

Al comprar estos artículos para la limpieza y mantenimiento de los baños públicos, podrá dar un mejor servicio a las personas que hacen uso de estas instalaciones. También podrá comprar estas artículos a mejores precios de esta manera podrá tener más ganancias  por comprar productos al mayor.

Sus planes a futuro son comenzar la construcción de la vivienda; ya que donde está viviendo es de los suegros y él ya quiere independizarse. También quiere establecer un pequeño negocio más de venta de frutas y verduras para su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old. He is married and has a son. For 10 years he has worked offering his services in the city market, specifically in the bathrooms because they are rented to him by city hall. He just pays the city rent taxes, and for water, electricity and other fees.

He makes sure that the bathrooms are in perfect condition when it comes to cleanliness, order, and safety, among other things.

He buys cleaning supplies in supermarkets and stores that are close to his business, as well as from suppliers that sell wholesale. They sell to hi on credit for two weeks. He wants to have a fund that will allow him to buy these items from other suppliers because with the money on hand (in cash) they sell to him at a better price. 

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 50 bundles of toilet paper, 25 quintals of paper towel, 5 dozen hand soaps, 5 dozen floor disinfectants, 5 mops, to pay for year's worth of taxes at city hall and for a load of firewood, etc.

Upon buying these items for cleaning and maintaing the public bathrooms, he will be able to provide a better service to the people who use these facilities. He will also be able to buy these items at better prices and thus have better profits by buying wholesale.

His plans for the future are to begin to build his house, since he is living with his parents in law and he wants to become independence. He also wants to open another small business to sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy 50 bundles of toilet paper, 25 quintals of paper towel, 5 dozen hand soaps, 5 dozen floor disinfectants, 5 mops, to pay a years worth of taxes to city hall and one load of firewood, etc.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 36-year-old man from Eregi Location in Vihiga County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Roselyne, who is a business lady and also supports the family. He has two children who are 5 and 3 years old respectively.

Wycliffe makes bricks, a business he has been doing for the last twelve years, and makes a monthly income of KES 25,000. He is taking his second loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase water and firewood for making bricks. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

He has a dream of having a big business and also has hopes of becoming able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase water and firewood for making bricks.

loans.name: 48 Jaya Group

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Tohiyah from Kebon Pala, Indonesia. She is married with two children, all of whom are attending school. She runs a retail business and sells a variety of vegetables, fish, chickens, and groceries.  She also runs a business laundry. The retail business has been in operation for three years and her laundry for four months. She sells her vegetables using a cart around environment from 08.00 AM - 01.00 PM.  She can get profits of about 1,500,000 IDR per month. 

She says the main challenges she faces are the rainy season and delinquent customers. She has requested a loan of 2,500,000 IDR in order to buy more vegetables, prawn crackers and hangers. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will facilitate increased business and improved family welfare. In the future, she plans to add a washing machine and to send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy hangers, prawn crackers  (5 kilos) and noodles (3 boxes) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a donkey cart for loading services.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man who lives with his wife and one child. He says that he worked as a salesperson in order to start his business; thanks to this, he was able to set up a butcher shop. Owing to his determination and hard work, in addition to his attentiveness, his business grew rapidly. Currently, he has a solid customer base.

The requested loan will be put toward the purchase of a refrigerator for better conservation of his products. James is grateful to the Yehu Microfinance Trust for the help that he has received, as this is an excellent opportunity for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for better conservation of his products.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses used the previous loan to buy local brew to sell.  He is a 27 year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For eight years now he has been selling local brew and he got start-up capital from his farming activities. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. He dreams of building a permanent house for a residence, educating his three children and moving his business to the capital city.

Moses intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old single man, who has been working as a curtain tailor for the last twelve years.  Ahmad was sixteen years old when he first started to learn about this job. In 2011, he opened his own business that has developed and improved his standard of living.

Ahmad is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary special curtain accessories and textiles.  This will be sure to increase his income and capital at the same time as he will be capable of responding to customer's requests freely.

He is hoping that when his business increases, he will be capable of moving to a larger place in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary special curtain accessories and textiles.

loans.name: Joi

texts.en:
Joi is 40 years-old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Joi is engaged in selling ready-to-wear clothes. She has been doing this kind of business for five years and she earns approximately 1,200 a month.  She has requested a loan to be used to pay for her son's tuition fees. 

Joi has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for almost eight years.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 58 years old. He is married with four children, aged between 1 and 30 years. Only two go to school. His wife works as a farmer. 

Samuel sells drinks of different types and has been in the business for ten years. With the loan, he will buy more beer and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, both soda and beer, for sale.

loans.name: Elsi Noemi

texts.es:
Elsi tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos; uno de 15 y otro de 12 años de edad. La señora tiene la más de 7 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de pan dulce y francés y también a la comercialización del mismo; esta actividad la aprendió de su esposo, quien es panadero.

Ella estaba manejando un crédito por la cantidad de $1,500.00 para fortalecimiento de la panadería con financiamiento KIVA. Pero este ya fue cancelado en una forma muy puntual hoy en día está solicitando otro por el mismo monto para la misma actividad.

Los artículos que  comercializa los vende en su casa de habitación y su esposo sale a venderlos en una bicicleta que tiene en la misma colonia donde ellos viven y lugares aledaños a la zona y por qué no decir en la ciudad. 

La  señora compra los artículos para la elaboración del pan ha distribuidores que se los llevan a su casa de habitación; ya que ellos no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para el traslado de estos insumos cuando se les terminas solo les llama para que se los lleven también estos distribuidores les dejan los insumos al crédito y se los cancelas al final de la semana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 
50 cartones de huevos, 25 quintales de harina de pan, 25 quintales de azúcar, 30 libras de manteca, 20 libras de sal, una carretada de leña. Etc.

Al comprar estos artículos para la elaboración de pan de diferentes clases se puede mencionar que la panadería tendrá una mayor venta de pan y por ende los ingresos aumentaran de esta manera podrá suplir la demanda existente en  la zona

Ella desea en un futuro comprar un horno industrial que funcione con energía eléctrica para poder hornear más pan; ya que en invierno solo puede hornear una vez por día, debido a la lluvia si compra el horno industrial podrá hornear dos veces por día ya que este estará dentro de la casa de habitación.

También desea construir una habitación; ya que  tiene dos hijos adolescentes que necesitan su propio espacio.
texts.en:
Elsi is 34 years old, married and has 2 children; a 15-year-old and a 12-year-old. She has been making and also selling sweet bread and French bread for more than 7 years; she learnt this craft from her husband who is a baker. She had a finance loan of $1,500.00 from KIVA to build up the bakery. But she has now repaid this on time and she is currently applying for another one to use for the same thing. 

She sells the products she makes from her home and her husband goes out to sell them from a bicycle in the neighborhood where they live in and in the surrounding area, if not in the city. 

Elsi buys the supplies to make the bread from distributors who bring it to her home since they lack the necessary resources to transport them. When they run out she calls to place her order by credit and pays for it at the end of the week. 

The loan that she is applying for from Fundación Campo is to buy 50 cartons of eggs, 25 quintals of flour for bread, 25 quintals of sugar, 30 pounds of butter, 20 pounds of salt, and a cartload of wood e.t.c. By buying these supplies to make different types of bread, the bakery will make more sales and as a result her income will increase. In this way she can satisfy the neighborhood demand. 

In the future she wants to buy an industrial oven which runs on electricity so she can bake more bread since in winter she can only bake once a day because of the rain. If she buys an industrial oven she'll be able to bake twice a day as it will be inside the house. She also wants to build a room as she has two adolescent boys who need their own space.

loans.use: to buy 50 cartons of eggs, 25 quintals of flour for bread, 25 quintals of sugar, 30 pounds of butter, 20 pounds of salt, a cartload of wood. Etc.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 22-year-old single man. He has worked as a crane driver for the past three years, until he got his own crane in 2012. This is Jamal's second loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; his previous loan helped him a lot in starting his own business. Today he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to perform necessary maintenance on his crane and to continue building his house. 

Jamal did not face any obstacles when he started his business, because he had previous relationships with a lot of people he had met before. He hopes that he will be able to buy more cranes in the future.

loans.use: To pay for necessary maintenance on his crane.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married and has children. She and her husband strive to always give their children a good education and to ensure that their needs are met.

Nuru has been working for the last three years selling firewood. She buys the product in various places in the interior of the country and sells it broken up in various sizes.

She requests the loan to buy bundles of firewood so that she can get it at a better price and earn higher profits to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is a mother of five children. She owns a business boutique selling various items. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize, sugar cane and other items to sell in her boutique. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize and sugar to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Ada Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Ada rosa vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja desde hace 18 años en una centro universitario como cardista
 Se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable en sus obligaciones de trabajo y familiares.

  doña Ada solicita a kiva un crédito para hacerles mejoras a su vivienda y para la compra de utensilios de prioridad para el hogar.

Agradece mucho a ceprodel porque con los prestamos otorgados ha construido su casa para darles mayor seguridad y comodidad  a su familia.
texts.en:
Ada Rosa lives in the city of Managua.  She has worked for a university for 18 years as a typist.  She's known as a responsible woman in her work and family obligations.

Ada's asking Kiva for a loan to make improvements to her house and buy tools she needs at home.

She's very grateful to CEPRODEL because she has used the loans she has received to build her house to give her family greater security and comfort.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor santos Mauricio vive en la cuidad de Managua, tiene su propio negocio en un populoso mercado de la capital desde hace 17 años  trabaja los 7 días de la semana donde su mejores días de ventas son los fines de semana  ya que  su negocio está  situado en la terminal de buses que viajan al norte de país en el negocio trabaja su esposa y su  hija que les ayuda por la mañana y en las tarde asiste a sus estudio.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en compra de mercadería  ya que el invierte en mercadería  conforme las  temporadas de año y en estos momento su inversión va hacer de ropa de verano  y mercadería en general para surtir su negocio el éxito del negocio de don santos es mantener  su negocio bien surtido para ofertarle a su clientela.

Don santo agradece a kiva y ceprodel por los créditos otorgados ya que  estos le   han permitido crecer  en su negocio y por ende  aumenta sus ganancias y con ella mantiene su familia, le da estudio a sus hijos , y poco a poco ha mejorado su casa ya que su negocio es la única entrada de dinero para su familia .
texts.en:
Santos Mauricio lives in the city of Managua.  He has had his own business in a busy market in the capital for 17 years.  He works seven days a week, with his best sales on the weekend because his business is located in the terminal for the buses that go to the northern part of the country.  His wife works in the business; his daughter helps them in the morning and attends school in the afternoon.

He's requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise, which he buys in accordance with the seasons of the year.  Right now he's going to invest in summer clothing and a variety of merchandise to stock his business.  The success of Santos's business is to keep it well stocked to sell merchandise to his customers.

Santos is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for the loans granted because they have allowed him to grow in his business and consequently increase his profits and support his family.  He pays for his children's education and little by little he has improved his house, because his business is his family's only source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Dúo Bellos Horizontes Group

texts.es:
DÚO BELLOS HORIZONTES
LA SEÑORA LOIDA  FLORENTINA DE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN PATZICIA CHIMALTENANGO,  ES VIUDA  Y SE DEDICA AL NEGOCIO QUE LE DEJO SU ESPOSO QUE ES UNA FARMACIA. ELLA TIENE    TRES HIJOS Y AHORA LE TOCA LUCHAR SOLA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MEDICINA PARA SU FARMACIA Y ESPERA QUE POR MEDIO DE USTEDES ELLA PUEDA OPTAR POR EL CREDITO YA QUE LO NECECITA PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE EN SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Bellos Horizontes Duo

Loida Florentina, 45, lives in Patzicia Chimaltenango.  She's a widow who makes a living in the pharmacy business her husband left her.  She has three children and now she has to struggle alone to get them ahead.

She's requesting this loan to buy medicine for her pharmacy.

She hopes to get the loan with your help because she needs it to continue making progress in her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a single mother of one child who attends school. 

She has a stall where she sells clothing and lingerie in Kisauni. She also has a retail shop that is located in her home and opens every day, both businesses have been active for the past one year.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise wholesale such as clothing, t-shirts, shirts, pants, etc. and to purchase various lingerie brands and patterns to offer greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale such as clothing, t-shirts, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 47 years old and married with three children, who are currently going to school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 54 years old and a married mother of six children. She is a rice grower in the local area as the primary source of income. She has engaged in this work for 31 years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she has managed to use her past loan wisely to uplift her living status and to support her business in a gradual manner. Moreover, she is able to send her children to study in Phnom Penh, Capital city of Cambodia, for a bright future. Now, she is seeking a new loan to pay for her son’s tuition fee. She hopes that this financial support will help her son so that he can pay more attention to his studies and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 26 years old and lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She is married with one child.    

Remelyn has a shop that sells grocery products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase assorted groceries to sell.

Remelyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Remelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten boxes of assorted groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for six years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a hardworking married woman, age 56, living in Kagadi, Uganda. She is involved in a number of activities, such as farming, leadership as a Councillor and selling clothes. With the proceeds she has been able to pay the school fees for her dependents and build a house. The ever changing customer needs and price fluctuations affect the business. Her dream is to have a boutique. Rosemary intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two dozen outfits for children, two dozen outfits for women and the same number of outfits for men.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 38 years old. He is a father of five children; two of them are in school. He has requested a loan to purchase more beans and sorghum to add to his stock. He hopes this will increase his sales. He will use the profits from the business to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Jennifer Morayma

texts.es:
JENNIFER  tiene 29 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con la mamá y los hijos en la ciudad de Gauaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC ALLY ÑAN esta conformada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, esta hubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina.

JENNIFER  realiza quehaceres domésticos en algunos casas. Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembras de maíz, habas, trigo, etc, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar medicina, calcio y vitaminas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las medicinas para la salud. Las compras las realizará en Guaranda.

El sueño es poner un negocio para ayudar a la familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es llegar a ser una buena madre para los hijos. En elt iempo lire le gusta ayudar a la madre.
texts.en:
JENNIFER is 29 years old, single, and has two children. She lives with her mother and the children in the city of Guaranda, province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the ALLY ÑAN communal bank, which is made up of 10 members who are from the same community. It is located 20 minutes from the office.

JENNIFER  does housework in some houses. She works as a farmer and grows corn, beans, wheat, etc. She also raises chickens.

She is asking for the loan to buy medicine, calcium and vitamins. With the help from the loan, she will be able to buy medicine for health. She will make the purchases in Guaranda.

Her dream is to open a business to help her family. The challenges she faces are becoming a good mother for her children. In her free time she likes to help her mother.

loans.use: to buy medicine, calcium and vitamins.  With the help of the loan, she'll be able to buy medicine for health.

loans.name: Darwin Geovanny

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 26 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con la mamá en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es Integrante de la VRC ALLY ÑAN está conformada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina.
Darwin es maestro cerrajero.  Se  dedica a la agricultura a la siembras de maíz, habas . Además se dedica a la crianza de gallos finos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar  barillas, máquina para sacar copias de llaves, semillas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras y el otro trabajo.
El sueño es aumentar el negocio de cerrajería.   Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer ejercicio con los amigos.
texts.en:
Darwin, 26, is single and has two children.  He lives with his mother in Guaranda, province of Bolívar.

He is a member of the communal bank ALLY ÑAN, which is comprised of ten members from his community.  It is about 20 minutes from the office.

Darwin is a master keysmith and also grows crops such as corn and lima bean.  He also raises chickens.

He is requesting a loan to buy metal rods, a key copying machine, seeds, urea and herbicides.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for planting and also for other work.

His goal is to expand his keysmith business, but he is up against a lot of competition.  In his free time he enjoys exercising with his friends.

loans.use: To buy metal rods, a key copying machine, seeds, urea and herbicides.

loans.name: Mirian Esthela

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 22 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es Integrante de la VRC ALLY ÑAN está conformada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina.

Mirian  se dedica al comercio de ganado, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembras de maíz, trigo y fréjol, además se dedica a la  crianza de cerdos, pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar  ganado, semillas, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el animal y lo que le hace falta para las siembras.

El sueño es tener una casa propia.   Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Mirian is twenty-two years old and is single with no children.  She lives with her parents in the city of Guaranda, in the province of Bolívar.  She is a member of the communal bank ALLY ÑAN, which is made up of ten members from the same community.  The community is twenty minutes away from the bank office.

Mirian makes a living in the livestock trade.  She is also dedicated to agriculture, growing corn, wheat, and beans.  Additionally, she raises pigs and chickens.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock, seeds, and urea.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy an animal and what she is still missing for her crops.

Her dream is to have her own house.  The challenge she faces is competition.  In her free time, she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy livestock, seeds, and urea.

loans.name: Verdiane

texts.en: Verdiane is 51 years old. She has one child aged 25. She sells bananas and has been in the business for ten years. She wants the loan to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used for renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 49 años de edad estado civil madre soltera tiene 6 hijos vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por 10 socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

Margarita se dedica a vender papas, queso, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas avena y mellocos, Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como son ganado y cerdos.

Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar fertilizantes, ures, vacunas para el ganado. Con la ayuda del credito podra mejorar la agricultura. Las compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es tener una buena ganadería.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener una casa.  En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is 49 years old, a single mother of 6 children, living in Guaranda Canton, in the province of Bolívar.

V.R.C Mushuc Pakari has 10 partners working in farming, 40 minutes from the office. 

Margarita sells potatoes and cheese. She is a farmer, growing potatoes, oats and mellocos (a tuber). In addition, she raises animals such as cattle and pigs.

She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, urea, and vaccines for the cattle. The loan will help her to improve farming. She does her shopping in Guaranda Canton. 

Her dream is to have good livestock. The challenge she faces is to have a house. She likes to spend her free time with her family.
Margarita tiene 49 años de edad estado civil madre soltera tiene 6 hijos vive en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, urea, and vaccines for the cattle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old, married, and works very hard to provide for her family.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods like soap, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Zhora

texts.en:
Zhora is 23 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his wife and an infant child. Zhora requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is income earned by Zhora working as a operator at a private company. It totals 400 Laris (GEL).  It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zhora requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Zhora will rent a commercial space and open an auto parts shop. He will buy and sell auto parts and will have a chance to increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to rent a commercial space and open an auto parts shop

loans.name: Visitacion's Group

texts.en:
Visitacion is 60 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with six children. 

Visitacion grow pigs as her business. She has been this business for two years. Visitacion requested a new loan to purchase feed for her pigs.

Visitacion has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of feed for pigs

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en: Altansuh is 25 years old and lives with his sibling and parents in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His father is a driver, and his mother is retired and stays home. His sibling is a university student. The borrower has been helping and driving his father's truck since he was little. He is now planning on providing transportation with his father's old truck, and he needs to buy new tires to start his business. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase new tires. He is a hardworking, enthusiastic, and sharp man.

loans.use: to purchase new tires to start his own transportation service business

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is 48 years old. He lives in Lagodekhi District with his 39-year-old wife and two children (14 and 12 years old). Iuri requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a small vineyard and a plot of agricultural land where fruit is grown. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets to get a small income. Iuri’s wife is a hospital nurse and she gets a small monthly salary which can hardly cover their food expenses.

Iuri requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Iuri will purchase a car. He wants to start driving it as a taxi and serve local people to bring in additional income for the family. With the increased income Iuri will be able to cover their monthly expenses and provide his children’s future studies.

loans.use: To buy a car to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Juana Isabel, es Madre de dos hijos y se desempeña como profesora docente de unos de los colegios de la ciudad de león desde hace 14 años dando el pan del saber a sus alumnos realiza esta labor de lunes a viernes con horario 7:00 am  y finaliza a las 1:00 pm.   Ella  hace este tipo de trabajo para llevar  el sustento a su familia.

Doña Juana solicita este crédito para gastos médico como es consulta médica, análisis clínico y compra de medicamento y así lograr a recuperar su salud.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel is a mother of two children and for 14 years she has worked as a teacher in one of the high schools in the city of Leon, where she gives students the bread of knowledge. She works Monday through Friday from 7:00 AM until 1:00 PM. She does this work in order to sustain her family.

Juana Isabel is requesting this loan in order to cover medical costs associated with a medical consultation, a clinical analysis, and the purchase of medication so that she recuperate her health.

loans.use: pay for a medical consultation, clinical analysis, and medication.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 25-year-old single man, who has been working as an auto mechanic since twelve years ago. He opened his own business in 2009, to improve his living.

Youssef is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy a special machine that he needs for his business, which detects carbon monoxide, if present in a car's engine. He will also increase his capital by buying car lubricants, to make sure that he can respond to several clients' requests at a time, without any delays caused by not having the right product in stock.

This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua. His previous loan helped him move to a larger working place, where he can accept more cars and distribute his products freely. He hopes to expand his work, in accordance with customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy a special machine that he needs for his business and to buy car oils

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman who lives with her husband at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanatumu has operated a business selling firewood for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of transportation to be her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase firewood to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto de 23 años de edad , esta casado con Esther y tiene un hijo de tanto solo 3 años.Comparte sus vivencias familiares junto a su pequeña familia en una casa que sus tíos le vendieron a un precio bajo por ser un joven muy trabajador.Se dedica a la producción y mantenimiento de plantaciones agrícolas tales como el cacao orgánico, palillo y café.Realiza sus labores en una parcela que adquirió junto a Esther  con el fruto de sus primeros años de trabajo en pareja.Inicialmente tuvo inconvenientes económicos debido a ser muy joven, no obstante con el transcurso de los años demostró a través de su trabajo que la edad no es un obstáculo cuando de salir adelante se trata.
Para desempeñar una campaña productiva de manera fluida es necesario contar con capital de trabajo para contratar trabajadores del lugar y acelerar las tareas agrícolas tales como son el retiro de maleza y cosecha de las mazorcas cacaoteras.Para mejorar sus ingresos a futuro planea iniciarse en la venta de ropa y ocupar laboralmente a su esposa en esta labor considerada algo más sencilla que el campo.Este es su primer crédito otorgado por Kiva y esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para reemplazar las columnas de su vivienda por sólidas columnas de cemento esperando así mejorar su calidad de vida y bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Alberto is 23 years old and married to Esther.  He has a three year old son and lives with his small family in a home that he bought from his aunt and uncle for a good price because he was young and a hard worker.  He has plantations and raises organic cacao, palillo (similar to the guava-tree), and coffee.  He works on the land he acquired with Esther, through the fruits of his labor in the first year as a couple.  At first he had some financial problems because he was so young, however after a few years he showed that age is not an obstacle to getting ahead.

In order to have a more fluid campaign he needs to be able to count on working capital so that he can hire workers from the area so that he can speed up the farm work such as weeding and harvesting the cocoa pods.  In order to improve his income in the future, he plans to start selling clothing and put his wife to work in this way, which is easier than working in the fields.

This will be his first loan through Kiva and he is very grateful for the opportunity and is committed to making his payments on time.  He would like a loan of 3,000 PEN so that he can replace the existing columns in his home with solid cement columns, hoping to improve his quality of life and his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos. Tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y comercio de tortillas esta actividad la ejerce en su casa de habitación; es ahí donde los clientes la buscan para comprarle las tortillas como también tiene encargos diarios de diferentes comedores de la ciudad. Esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá que también se dedicaba a esta actividad.   
La señora ya canceló un crédito KIVA y este fue cancelado en una forma muy puntual. Hoy necesita más financiamiento para fortalecer su negocio de venta de tortillas.

La  señora compra los artículos para la elaboración y comercio de tortillas a productores de la zona norte del país los fines de semana específicamente el día domingo;  ya que este es el día de comercio en la ciudad y la leña a personas que ejercen esta actividad de búsqueda de leña para vender. La plaza donde compra el maíz y la leña se encuentra a una distancia de un kilómetro de su casa de habitación 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 20 quintales de maíz, 2 carretadas de leña, 25 libras de cal, un Silo metálico para almacenar el maíz

Al comprar estos artículos para la elaboración de tortillas el cliente tendrá más materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos de esta manera tendrá  almacenado los granos para tiempo de escaces no perder el negocio de la venta de  tortillas.

Ella tiene planes de construir una cocina y hacer una galera ya que donde se encuentra la cocina en el tiempo de lluvia se moja y los clientes se molestan; ya que ellos también se mojan.
texts.en:
Blanca is 44 years old and has three children. She has been making and selling tortillas for over 10 years. She runs this business from her home; that's where the customers come to buy the tortillas. She also has daily orders from various eateries in town. She learned this trade from her mother who was also in this line of work.
This lady has already repaid a Kiva loan, and it was repaid in a timely fashion. She currently needs another loan in order to bolster her tortilla sales business.
Blanca buys the supplies for making and selling the tortillas from farmers from the northern area of the country. This happens on weekends, particularly on Sunday, since this is the town's market day and there are people who seek firewood for selling. The town square where she buys the corn and the firewood is located one kilometer from her home.
The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase 20 quintals of corn, 2 truckloads of firewood, 25 pounds of lime and a metal silo for storing the corn.
By purchasing these items for making tortillas, she'll have more supplies in order to make more products. That way she'll store the grains, so that she won't lose her tortilla sales business during a time of shortage.
She has plans to build a kitchen and a covered patio, since the location of the kitchen gets wet when it rains, and that bothers the customers who get wet as well.

loans.use: to purchase 20 quintals of corn, 2 truckloads of firewood, 25 pounds of lime and a metal silo for storing the corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for making fast food.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
A 56-year-old mother of six children, Orn is a local school teacher in the area. She has engaged in this occupation for four years. Including this loan, she is a two-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the past loan, which she has repaid, she feels empowered that she can sustain her living at a good pace. 

Currently, four out of Orn’s six children are studying at the university, which is quite a huge burden for her.
