To relieve some of this burden, she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund to pay for school fees for one of her sons, the university student in the local school majoring in engineering. 

She hopes that her son can have a specific skill so he can get a good job and earn more income to help the family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for one of her sons.

loans.name: Jersam

texts.en: Jersam is 59 years old, and widowed with 2 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for making food. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for making food

loans.name: Lao

texts.en: A local citizen from Takeo Province, Lao is 51 years old, married, and blessed with six children. For her family, rice-cropping and pig-raising are the main sources of the family’s income. Her husband also helps to earn income through playing traditional music during wedding ceremonies and owning a small rice mill machine. She has been engaged in her current business for 31 years. This is Lao's fourth loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid her past loans wisely in order to upgrade her living and her business. For this cycle, she is taking out the loan to pay for the university tuition of her daughter, who is a freshman majoring in finance and banking. She hopes that her daughter does not need to worry about financial issues related to her studies so she can pay attention to pursuing her academic degree and getting a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Iris Jackeline

texts.es: Iris, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, vive en un barrio suburbano de San Pedro Sula. Hace 5 años que ella estableció su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de primera necesidad, como ser granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, productos de aseo, productos enlatados, lácteos, refrescos, churros, etc. su negocio se ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de préstamos. actualmente esta solicitando el tercer ciclo el cual es por 5,500 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, lácteos, refrescos, churros y pan para vender y mantener producto en inventario. Poco a poco va diversificando su negocio y atendiendo mejor a sus clientes. Su plan es mejorar el nivel económico de la familia y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Iris is 29 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Five years ago, Iris established her own grocery business where she sells basic staples such as grains, sugar, lard, cleaning products, canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, donuts, and other items. Her business has remained stable as a result of investing the loans.

Iris is currently requesting her third loan in the amount of 5,500 HNL so that she can buy basic grains, sugar, lard, dairy products, soft drinks, donuts, and bread to sell. As a result, she will maintain her inventory of products. Over time she intends to diversify her business and provide better service to her customers. Her plan is to improve her family’s financial standing and their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, lard, dairy products, soft drinks, donuts, and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica al cultivo. Él está casado, tiene 23 años de edad y vive con sus padres. Juan realiza cultivo de granos básicos para obtener los ingresos necesarios y así poder ayudar para los gastos del hogar; el trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm, este lo aprendió con sus padres y lleva tres años de trabajar en lo propio. 
El préstamo lo requiere para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros. Esto lo permitirá aumentar la productividad y sus ingresos porque podrá invertir con el crédito de KIVA.
Su objetivo es mejorar las condiciones económicas para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer. He is 23 years old, married, and lives with his parents. Juan cultivates basic grains so that he can generate the necessary income to help with the household expenses. He works Monday through Saturday from 6:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M. Juan learned this trade from his parents and has been working on his own for three years.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other items. By investing his Kiva loan, Juan will be able to increase his productivity and his income. His goal is to improve his financial condition so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Ricardo Javier

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo Javier, es padre de tres  hijos, posee un pequeño tramo de venta de tortillas y bolsas plásticas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace 5 años, inicia sus labores desde las 3:00am  en la elaboración de tortillas posterior se traslada a su tramo así mismo distribuye bolsas plásticas de toda clase a su clientela,  el  realiza este tipo de trabajo para llevar el sustento  a su familia. 

El señor Ricardo está solicitando un crédito para compra de zinc, perlines y golosos y así realizar mejora a su humilde vivienda ya que se aproxima el invierno, lo que permitirá brindar mejor confort y mejorar su calidad de vida para sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Ricardo Javier is the father of three children.  For the last five years, he's had a small sales stall in one of the markets in León, where he sells tortillas and plastic bags.  Señor Ricardo starts working at 3:00am making tortillas.  He later transfers them to his sales stall, where he also sells all types of plastic bags to his customers.  He does this work to support his family.  

Señor Ricardo is requesting the loan to purchase metal sheeting, beams and screws to make improvements to his humble abode.  Winter is approaching, and the improvements will allow him to offer his small children more comfort and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting and beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 24-year-old lady from Eregi Location, Vihiga County, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Geofrey, who is a farmer, and they have one child who is two years old.

She sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase cereals to resell, like maize, beans and millet. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business. She has a dream of running a successful business and supporting her little child.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans and millet, to resell at her business

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento SAN LUIS está  compuesto por doce integrantes nueve mujeres y tres  varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Edith tiene 52 años, y hijos  ya independientes,  la Sra.  Edith se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad santa cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Edith va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra.  Edith va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra.  Edith es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The SAN LUIS entrepreneurial bank is made up of 12 members, nine ladies and three gentlemen.  Edith is the bank’s president.  She’s 52 years old and has adult children on their own.  Edith sells cosmetics through catalogs and makes her sales on foot, visiting homes and public and private offices in Santa Cruz, where she offers her products.  This will be her first loan through the institution and Edith will use it to buy cosmetics and jewelry in quantity.  It’s currently on sale and in this way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers and also increase her income.  She is asking for this loan so that she can continue improving her business.  Edith will use the benefits to continue buying beauty products.  She is a very hardworking person and is happy about the opportunities given her and her fellow group members who in some cases must support their families alone.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a married woman who has eight children. She is 58 years old and resides in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Edna owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 from her business. Edna is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Edna wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings, and young crops

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is married with three school-age children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Bintihamisi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Vivenda

texts.en:
Vivenda is 44 years old and married with four children.
Vivenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell dry goods store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell.
Vivenda has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the buy-and-sell dry goods store for six years and also earns an additional income from a general store.
Vivenda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Juana Yadira

texts.es: Doña Juana, quien laboro para una empresa de marisco años atrás como responsable de lavandería, renuncio para dedicarse al negocio de pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación, para ayudar a su esposo quien trabaja de operario en el mercado mayoreo, sus hijos son casados e independientes, ahora Juana con el préstamo desea invertir en la venta con productos como granos básicos, carnes, pollo, lácteos, gaseosas para mantener siempre productos disponibles para la necesidad de sus clientes y así en un futuro crecer más económicamente, para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Juana worked in a seafood plant years ago and was in charge of the laundry service.  She resigned to start a general store out of her home so that she could help her husband who works in a large market.  Her children are married and on their own.  Now Juana wants to use the money from this loan to keep products on hand to meet her customers’ needs and be able to grow financially in the future and support her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Tatiana Del

texts.es:
Tatiana, de 38 años de edad, originaria de León, acompañada, madre de 2 hijos,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de frescos  y al negocio de pulpería de la que es dueña hace mas de tres años, debido a sus condiciones económica  solo logro terminar su segundo grado de primaria.
Inicio su negocio, con capital propio, dinero que tenia ahorrado de su anterior negocio que era la venta de tortillas, luego decidió dejar este negocio porque no le generaba mucha ganancias, fue asi que decidió emprender su pulpería, ya que en la zona en donde el vive no hay pulpería cerca, ya que esta es una muy buena oportunidad de obtener mas cliente que le compren su mercadería.
Tatiana  esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, gaseosa, galletas y a la misma vez compra frutas como melon y piña para hacer sus deliciosos frescos. Ella estima que este crédito  le ayudara a crecer mas en su negocio comprando productos que aun no tiene en existencia, de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Tatiana, who is 38 years old, is a native of León, lives with her partner and is the mother of two children.  She works as a retailer.  She makes her living selling juices and running a small grocery, which she has owned for over three years.  Because of her financial situation, she was only able to complete two years of primary school.  
Tatiana started her business with her own capital.  She had money saved from her previous business selling tortillas.  She later decided to leave that business because it didn't generate much profit.  Tatiana then decided to open up her grocery.  In the area Tatiania lives, there is no grocery nearby.  It was a good opportunity for earning customers to purchase her merchandise. 
Tatiana is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, beans, sodas and crackers and also fruit, like melon and pineapple, for making her delicious juices.  She thinks that this loan will help her to grow her business.  She will be able to purchase more products that she doesn't have in stock and thereby earn a better profit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, sodas, crackers and also fruit, like melon and pineapple.

loans.name: Marcia María

texts.es:
La señora Marcia María, es Madre de tres  hijos de los cuales solo dos está a su cargo y se desempeña como profesora docente de unos de los colegios de la ciudad de león desde hace 28 años dando el pan del saber a sus alumnos realiza esta labor de lunes a viernes con horario 7:00 am  y finaliza a las 1:00 pm.   Ella  hace este tipo de trabajo para llevar  el sustento de su familia.

Doña Marcia, esta solicitado este crédito para ser utilizado en pago de aranceles y compra de libros de sus dos hijos que estudian en la universidad.

Ella sueña que sus hijos logren a coronar su carrera y continuar con la mejora de humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Marcia Maria is the mother of three sons, of whom only two are in her charge. She has worked as a teacher at one of the schools in Leon for 28 years, giving the gift of knowledge to her pupils. She works from Monday to Friday, starting at 7:00am and finishing at 1:00pm. She does this type of work in order to support her family.

Marcia is requesting this loan in order to pay fees and purchase books for her two children who are studying at university. 

She dreams of her children managing to finish their degrees and continuing to improve their humble home.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and to purchase school supplies

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Martha Carolina, es Madre de dos hijos, se desempeña como profesora docente de unos de los colegios de la ciudad de león desde hace 11 años dando el pan del saber a sus alumnos realiza esta labor de lunes a viernes con horario 7:00 am  y finaliza a las 1:00 pm.   Ella  hace este tipo de trabajo para llevar  el sustento a su familia.

Doña Martha además de trabajar como docente vende cosméticos a sus compañeras labores y público en general, debido a este tipo de trabajo se presentó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para ser  utilizado en  compra  de cosméticos tales como: perfumes, pinturas de uñas y de labios , cremas, shampoo Vanidades, etc. 

Ella realiza estas labores para tener más ingresos y lograr así mejorar su humilde vivienda. La señora  sueña que sus dos hijos coronen una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Martha Carolina is a mother to two children. She has worked as a teacher at one of the schools in the city of Leon for 11 years, giving the gift of knowledge to her students. She works from Monday to Friday, starting at 7:00am and finishing at 1:00pm. She does this type of work in order to support her family.

As well as working as a teacher, Martha sells cosmetics to her colleagues and to the general public. Accordingly, she has applied to CEPRODEL for a loan which she will use to purchase cosmetics, such as perfumes, nail polish, lipsticks, creams, shampoos, Vanidades [a magazine], etc.

She does this work in order to have a higher income and thereby improve her humble home. She dreams of her two children having a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, nail polish, lipstick, creams, shampoo, and Vanidades [a magazine].

loans.name: Dúo Trabajo Y Cosecha Group

texts.es:
DUO TRABAJO Y COSECHA
Don Tranquilino es originario del caserío Pacorral, municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 43 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace años.
Don Tranquilino se dedica a la siembra de Maíz, frijol, verduras y a la siembra de fresa, desde hace años y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante con su familia, gracias al poyo de su esposa el sigue realizando todos los días sus labores para poder tener buenas cosechas.
El sueño de el es sembrar más variedad de productos para obtener mas ganancias y así poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor,Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas de verduras para el cultivo.
texts.en:
DUO TRABAJO Y COSECHA

Don Tranquilino is originally from Pacorral, a municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala. He is 43 years old and his four underaged children are in his care. He makes a living from agriculture, an activity which he has been doing for years. 

Don Tranquilino has sown corn, beans, vegetables, and strawberries for years. Thanks to God he and his family have been able to get ahead little by little. He continues doing his work every day, thanks to the help of his wife, in order to have good harvests.

His dream is to sow a greater variety of produce in order to have greater profits and thereby be able to send his children to school to obtain a better future. He is requesting this loan in order to buy vegetable seeds for his crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for growing vegetables

loans.name: Hernán Dario

texts.es:
Hernán Darío de 31 años de edad, es un hombre con una proyección gigantesca. Su gran sueño fue convertirse en barbero, el cual logró gracias a su esfuerzo y el apoyo de su familia. Después de estudiar el oficio, se empleó, lo que le permitió adquirir experiencia y desarrollar su potencial. Hoy la propietaria del local se encuentra vendiendo el negocio, por lo cual Hernán ve su oportunidad de convertirse en microempresario y desea comprarlo. Por su condición económica no posee el dinero para dicha inversión, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que dará la cuota inicial. 
Su mayor sueño es poder comenzar a trabajar como independiente, pues asegura que aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Hernán Darío is 31-years old.  He is a man with a gigantic project.  His greatest dream was to become a barber.  He was able to do so, thanks to his own hard work and support from his family.   After studying the trade, he got a job at a barber's shop.  The job allowed him to gain experience and develop his potential.  Now, the owner of the shop is looking to sell the business.  Hernán see this as his opportunity to become a small business owner, and he wants to purchase the business.  Due to his financial situation, Hernán doesn't have the money for said investment.  That is the reason he is requesting the loan, which would give him the down payment. 
Hernán's greatest dream to be able to work independently.  He says it would improve his quality of life and that of his nuclear family.

loans.use: to purchase a barber's shop.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel tiene 55 años de edad, es acompañado y tiene cinco hijos. Él desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura; oficio que aprendió de su madre. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. junto a su esposa para alistarse e irse donde tienen sus cultivos, ahí siembran maíz, fríjol y durante la tarde trabaja en una jicotera; su esposa va al mercado a vender los jocotes y ayudar a su esposo.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para mejorar su vivienda, ya que en invierno se moja toda la casa y su familia esta intranquila por su seguridad. Su propósito es, comprar unas vacas para producir leche y poderla vender.
texts.en:
Fidel is 55 years old, married and has five children.  He has been farming for many years and learned this from his mother.  He gets up at 4:00 am with his wife and goes to where his crops are.  He raises corn and beans, and works on cauliflower in the evenings.  His wife goes to the market to sell the cauliflower to help her husband.

He will use the loan that he is requesting trough Fundación Campo to help make improvements to his home because everything gets wet during the winter and his family is concerned for their security.  He will use the money to buy some dairy cows so he can sell the milk.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es: Clemencia, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en Choloma, Cortes. Clemencia, siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y hace 5 años decidió  vender mercadería como ropa,vestidos, faldas, camisas,etc.   Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Y lo ha mantenido estable con la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el septimo préstamo que es por 15000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa nueva.  Con este préstamo aprovecha a comprar de contado y consigue descuentos lo que le permite obtener más ganancias. Su meta es seguir creciendo tener una mejor fuente de ingresos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en: Clemencia is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Choloma, Cortes.  Clemenca has always been a businesswoman and decided to begin selling items such as clothing, dresses, skirts, shirts, etc., five years ago.  This business is her source of income to support her family and she has kept it stable through the help of various loans.  She is currently asking for her seventh loan of 15,000 Lempiras which she will use to by new clothing.  This loan will allow her to take advantage of discounts for buying in cash, which will allow her to obtain better earnings.  Her goal is to continue growing and have a better source of income with which to support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel, es padre de ocho  hijos de los cuales uno está a su cargo, labora como guarda de seguridad en una de las empresas de seguridad de la ciudad de León desde hace un año, el  realiza este tipo de trabajo para llevar el sustento  de su familia. 

El señor Miguel está solicitando este crédito para compra de zinc, perlines y golosos y así realizar mejora a su humilde vivienda ya que se aproxima el invierno, lo que permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida al igual que brindarle a su familia un mayor confort y seguridad.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is the father of eight children, one of whom is his dependent. He has worked as a security guard for one of the security companies in the city of León for one year; he does this type of work to provide for his family.

Miguel is requesting a loan to buy metal sheeting, roof beams, and screws to make improvements to his humble residence since winter is coming. This will allow him to improve his standard of living as well as to give his family better comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and roof beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene la edad de 40 años, es casada y con una carga familiar de 2 hijos, los cuales estan en edad escolar. 

cuenta con un negocio de venta de atoles, siendo este un negocio ambulante, ya que sus clientelas están en las diferentes instituciones que existen en la ciudad.

 cuenta con una experiencia en el negocio de 24 años dedicándose desde muy joven a esta actividad. La amabilidad y el buen trato hacia sus clientes hace que ella mantenga la fidelidad de los mismos, ademas de la calidad de sus atoles.

Es una persona con espíritu de superación, luchadora y con mucha disposición al trabajo, ya que su objetivo es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

El crédito le ha servido de mucho porque ademas de invertir en el negocio le ha permitido realizar algunas mejoras en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 40-years old.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  

Señora Ana has a business selling "atoles" (a thick drink made with corn and a mix of wheat, rice, milk, sugar, clove and cinnamon that is often eaten with a spoon).  Because Señora Ana's customers are in different city institutions hers is a mobile business. 
  
Señora Ana has 24 years of experience in the business, as she has made her living with this activity from a very young age.  In addition to the quality of her "atoles," Señora Ana's friendliness and good customer service have earned her the loyalty of her customers. 

She is a person with a desire to improve and a hard-working spirit.  She has a great aptitude for her work, and her objective is to give her children the best. 

The loan has greatly served Señora Ana because in addition to investing in the business, it has allowed her to make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, disposable cups and spoons and "Arroz Faisan" (a brand-name long-grain rice).

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past ten years. She sells from home to her neighbors. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating charcoal into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase bundles of firewood to re-sell. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to re-sell.

loans.name: Elvie's Group

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad ZDN. She is married with four children. Elvie is engaged in the fish industry. She has been selling fish for eight years. She has requested a loan to pay for business permits and licenses. Elvie has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. 
Elvie is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To pay for business permits and other licenses

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 28 years old from Migori, Kenya. She is married to Owuor, who is employed, and has four children aged between two and eight years old.

She has been selling fish in Migori market for 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more varieties of fish to sell to the community. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

She has a dream of becoming stable in her business and also supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de las Vegas Santa Bárbara junto a su hermano y cuñada. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde muy joven y produce café y banano. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la comunidad. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para el cultivo de café y banano, con esta inversión va aumentar la producción y sus ventas. Su plan es seguir dependiendo de su negocio para el sostenimiento de la familia y que sus hijos tengan la cultura de trabajar.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 45 years old and lives in a village within the city of Las Vegas Santa Barbara, along with his brother and sister in law.  He was always been a farmer and has been raising coffee and bananas since he was very young.  He sells his crops at the local market.  He is asking for a second loan of 5,000 Lempiras through ODEF, which he will use to buy fertilizer and supplies for his coffee and banana crops.  This will allow him to increase his production and sales.  His plan is to continue depending on his business to support his family and for his children to have a work ethic.

loans.use: to by supplies.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She cites food as her greatest monthly expense.

Mariam sells lesos (women wrap cloth) in a business which has been operational for the last three years. Her potential clients are neighbors and town dwellers. She cites seasonality as a challenge in her business.

With the 20,000 KES  loan, she wants to purchase 60 pairs of leso for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase 60 pairs of leso (women wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha is a 54-year-old widow and mother of six children. She has managed a two hectare area for growing rice as key source of income. She earns about 37,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been running for years. Her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was five cycles ago. She has fully repaid back her past loan with success to stablize her business. For this loan, she formed a group of four female members and is the group leader. Sokha is going to spend her loan portion to cover the necessary expenses for her child’s wedding. She hopes her child’s wedding ceremony will run smoothly through this loan.

loans.use: To cover the necessary expenses for her child’s wedding

loans.name: Asiimwe

texts.en: Asiimwe is a 36-year-old married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. For five years, she has been dealing in agricultural produce but also sells pancakes to earn a living. Stiff competition and price fluctuation affect her business. Her dream is to own a food store that can supply her customers all year round. Asiimwe intends to use the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: El grupo “DIOS ES AMOR” es un recurrentes cada una de sus integrantes de dedica a actividades diversas del comercio minorista. Victoria tiene 52 años casada dedicada a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado La Arenera de huaycan. Su mayor deseo es comprar un terreno para sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA. Victoria es la más alta del grupo viste con polo verde
texts.en:
The group “Dios Es Amor” (“God is love”) have recurring loans. Each one of its members dedicate themselves to diverse activities within the retail sector.

Victoria is 52 years old and married. She makes a living by selling groceries in La Arenera Market in Huaycan. Her greatest wish is to buy a piece of land for her children. The group is grateful to Kiva investors. Victoria is the tallest member of the group and is wearing a green polo shirt in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, beans, and lentils

loans.name: Vicenta Lucia

texts.es:
El Jicaral es un bello y encantador municipio ubicado en el departamento de León, donde existen diferentes actividades comerciales. 

 Vicenta Lucia se llama la Joven de 30 años edad Luchador por su vida, cuenta con 2 hijos bajo su cargo trabaja como maestra de educación primaria, es madre soltera con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ajusta en el sustento diaria de su familia. 

 Viendo la necesidad que ella presenta y con lo poco que gana mantiene a su familia, pero es de gran necesidad darle un repello a las paredes de su vivienda y construir una pared, por tal razón solicita a kiva y ceprodel que le brinden un crédito para la compra de: Cemento, Arena Y Ladrillo esto sería uno de sus principales sueños vivir en una mejor vivienda con sus dos hijitos que tanto ama y estima.  .

Agradece a kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado a través de estos pequeños créditos y que siempre le sigan dando la mano amigable.
texts.en:
El Jicaral is a beautiful and charming municipality located in the department of Leon, where various commercial activities exist.

Vicenta Lucia is a young woman of 30 years old who is a fighter in life. She has two children in her care and she works as a primary school teacher. She is a single mother. The little that she earns hardly supports the daily needs of her family.

It is of great importance to whitewash the walls of her home and build a wall. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL so she can purchase cement, sand, and brick. One of her biggest dreams is to live in a better home with her two small children whom she loves and appreciates so much.

She is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for the help they have given her through these small loans and for the helping hand they continue to extend to her.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and brick

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Her husband has a position at a power and heat station. Her son and daughter both study at high school. She has been working as a dressmaker since 2000 and accumulated a vast amount of work experience making clothes. Now she wants to open her own workshop by renting a basement, purchasing equipment and making repairs. She is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to cover the costs associated with opening a dressmaking workshop. As a result, she can generate more income for her family and invest in her children's future education. The borrower is a  very hardworking individual who deeply cares for her children and husband.

loans.use: to open a dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a divorced woman with four children under her care. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamkuu has operated a fruit selling business for the past six years. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs moving fruit from rural areas to urban areas. Her major goal is to own a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaws. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaws.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: Don Mario, es un hombre trabajador su esposa ama de casa que se encarga del orden del hogar, continua adelante con su venta de ropa nueva variada ubicado en un mercado de Managua en donde sus créditos los ha venido invirtiendo para el desarrollo de su negocio, por el cual está solicitando el crédito para seguir invirtiendo, espera crecer y en el futuro poder tener otra tiendita en otro local, para que sus hijos lo administren.
texts.en:
Don Mario is a hardworking gentleman. His wife is a homemaker who is in charge of keeping their house in order.

He continues to sell various types of new clothing at a market in Managua. The loans he has invested have helped to develop his business. Mario is requesting a loan so that he can continue investing. He expects to grow and open another shop in the future at another location. His children will manage the other shop.

loans.use: to buy general clothing, shoes, cosmetics, undergarments, and other products.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 25-year-old married man; he is the father of one child. He has been working selling clothes, especially women's traditional cloaks (abaya), from his house. He is also employed in a company for additional income to improve his family's living.

Kamal is a hard worker who puts so much effort into pleasing everyone around him, and to making sure that he can provide his family with everything they need.

His business is going just fine, and he is preparing himself to buy a new spring and summer collection; that's why he applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. He will also help his brother with his dental medication.

He hopes to stay capable of replying to anyone's needs, especially his family members.

loans.use: to buy a special spring and summer collection of clothing to sell, and to help his brother with dental medication.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Don Alfonso, tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, vive en el municipio de Siguatepeque junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva aproximadamente 20 años en ese rubro. Comenzó cultivando granos básicos y ahora produce café en pergamino y lo vende a intermediarios en el mercado local de la zona. El ha mantenido con buena asistencia sus cultivos mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. Actualmente ha solicitado el decimo préstamo el cual es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, limpieza y siembra de café. La inversión le ayudara a seguir mejorando la finca y obtener mayor producción. Su plan es aumentar el cultivo y la producción.
texts.en:
Don Alfonso is 51 years old, married, and lives in the town of Siguatepeque with his wife and their three children. He has always been a farmer and has worked approximately 20 years in this trade.

Alfonso started out selling basic grains, but now he produces coffee in parchment and then sells it to brokers at the local market. He has kept his crops well-maintained as a result of investing several loans. Alfonso is requesting his tenth loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that he can buy compost, fertilizers, and pay for weeding and the planting of coffee. This investment will help him to continue improving his farm and obtain better production. His plan is to expand his crop and his production.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and pay for weeding and the planting of coffee.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 48 años de edad , esta casada y tiene tres hijos, de 31, 27 y 25 años quienes obviamente ya son independientes, vive solo con el ultimo de sus hijos quien aun estudia y esta en la culminación de su etapa académica. Vive en su casa propia y ahí disfruta de dar lo mejor de si por el bien de su familia.El trabajo de Domitila, consiste en la venta de frutas regionales durante el día, ella sale a la vereda de su casa y ahí exhibe las deliciosas frutas los cuales son comprados en el mercado mayorista regional, además ella por las noches vende comida regional y ofrece a sus clientes diferentes comidas por dia. Lleva 10 años realizando este trabajo el cual lo hace sola.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da el espacio suficiente para tener dos ingresos en su hogar, además la cocina siempre fue su pasión y le gusta desde muy pequeña, agradece que le esta yendo bien ya que sus clientes son fieles por su buena sazón.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 3000 soles para la compra de frutas regionales para venderlos entre sus clientes, además comprará insumos con los que prepara los alimentos que vende , a su vez está feliz por esta oportunidad brindada ya que le permite seguir creciendo económicamente y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en: Domitila is 48 years old, married, and has three children, ages 31, 27, and 25 who are obviously on their own now.  She only lives with her youngest son, who is studying and finishing his education.  She has a home of her own and gives the best for her family.  Domitila sells regional fruit during the day.  She goes out to her veranda and shows her delicious fruit to buyers from the main regional market.  She also sells local food in the evenings and different foods during the day.  She has been doing this on her own for ten years.  What she likes about this is that she has enough space to have two household incomes; also cooking has always been her passion since she was very young.  She is grateful that things are going well for her and that her customers are steady because of her great seasoning.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN in order to buy local fruit to sell.  She will also buy ingredients to prepare the foods she sells.  She is happy about this opportunity which will allow her to continue growing financially and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Fernando es originario del municipio de El Sauce, padre de familia de dos niños en edad escolar. Estudió la carrera de Turismo, actualmente se desempeña como Responsable de Danza y cultura para una Institución privada que ayuda a los niños de escasos recursos donde tiene varios años de laborar.

Ejerce su trabajo con paciencia y dedicación porque es lo que le apasiona enseñar a bailar a estos niños de diferentes edades donde forma grupos de danzas que participan en distintas actividades sobre todo bailan la música de Folklor que es lo típico y tradicional de Nicaragua.

En su trabajo le solicitan como requisito que tiene que tener el título universitario para optar a tener un mejor salario, por tal razón está solicitando a los inversionistas de Kiva que le financien un crédito a través de Ceprodel para tramitar dicho título y tener un mejor nivel social tanto para él como para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Fernando is from the town of El Sauce. He is the father of school-aged children. He studied a career in Tourism, and currently works as the head of Dance and Culture for a private institution that helps low-income children. He has worked there for several years. 

He works with patience and dedication because it is his passion to teach dance to those children of different ages who form dance groups that participate in different activities. Above all they dance to folk music that is typical and traditional to Nicaragua.

In his work they require that he has a university degree in order to get a better salary. For that reason, he is asking the Kiva lenders to finance him through Ceprodel to process his degree and have a better social level for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay to process his university degree.

loans.name: Gerardo Eduardo

texts.es:
El Señor Gerardo Eduardo, tiene un negocio de venta de dulcerías ambulante en ciudad de León y  una mini pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace 22 años, realiza este trabajo para la mantención de su  hogar.

Don Gerardo  se presentó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para ser  utilizado en  compra  de zinc, perlines  y mano de obra, para la  reparación del techo de su humilde vivienda ya que se aproxima el invierno y así  darle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo Eduardo has a business selling sweets in the streets of León as well as a mini-mart in his home. He has run his businesses for 22 years, and they are how he maintains his household.

Gerardo came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to use to buy tin roofing, tiles and cost of labor to repair the roof of his humble home, since winter is coming and he wants to make his family more secure.

loans.use: to buy tin roofing, tiles and cost of labor.

loans.name: Dúo Esmeraldas Group

texts.es:
DUO ESMERALDAS
ESTE DUO ESTA CONFORMADO POR  ANA ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE, SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE CERDOS. ES UNA MUJERE QUE LUCHA POR SALIR ADELANTE Y DINAMICA CON GANAS DE TRABAJAR PARA PODER VIVIR DE UNA MANERA DIGNA, ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE CERDOS PARA LA CRIANZA ESPERA QUE POR MEDIO DE USTEDES ATRAVEZ DEL CREDITO ELLA PUEDA SALIR ADELANTE EN SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
The group “Esmeraldas” includes Ana, who is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. She raises pigs. Ana is a determined and dynamic woman who strives to move forward in her work so that she can live in a decent manner.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy pigs to raise. By receiving this loan, she expects to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Dúo Hombres Trabajadores Group

texts.es:
DUO HOMBRES TRABAJADORERS
Don Alberto es originario del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 24 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos el se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando diferentes tipos de productos como, maíz, frijol, hortalizas y verduras.
El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace algunos años ya que es el medio que el tiene para sacar adelante a su familia, gracias al apoyo de su esposa don Alberto todos los días se dedica a sus labores para tener mejores cosechas.
El sueño de el es tener un poco mas de capital para poder sembrar sus productos en cualquier tiempo del año, ya que de esa forma el tendrá mejores ganancias y así mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas para el cultivo de verduras.
texts.en:
Two hardworking men

Alberto, 24, is from the town of Tecpan, Guatemala. He has two children in his care. He works as a farmer, planting different products like corn, beans, and vegetables.

He has been doing this for some years and it's the way that he takes care of his family. Thanks to the help of his wife, Alberto works every day to have a better harvest.

His dream is to have more capital to be able to plant his produce in all seasons, since this way he will have better earnings and be able to send his kids to school so that they will have a better future. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds to plant vegetables.

loans.use: to be seeds to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es: El grupo “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE MORON” se encuentra pasando el quinto ciclo es un grupo puntual en sus cuotas cada de uno sus integrantes de dedican a diferentes aéreas del comercio. Dina es viuda tiene 5 hijos se dedica a la venta de golosinas hace 2 años. Antes de dedicaba al trabajo domestico. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas para agrandar su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA. Dina es la primera del lado derecho viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen del Carmen de Moron” is in its fifth loan cycle. This group is punctual with its payments. Each of the members engages in a different line of trade.

Dina is widowed and has five children. She has been selling snack foods for the past two years. Dina previously worked as a domestic employee. The loan she obtained will be invested in the purchase of snacks so that she can expand her business.

The group is appreciative of the Kiva lenders. Dina is the first woman on the right wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy a large display case and more treats to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Joven Ruth del Socorro, es madre soltera de dos hijas labora arduamente como farmacéutica en un centro de salud  de la ciudad de León desde hace tres años realiza esta labor de lunes a viernes con horario 7:00 am  y finaliza a las 3:00 pm.  Ella  hace este trabajo para la mantención de sus dos lindas hijas.

La joven Ruth se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un  crédito  para sufragar gastos medicos de su querida Madre, como es el costo de consulta y compra  medicamento.  

Cabe mencionar que la señora espera la recuperación pronta de su querida Mamá.
texts.en:
Ruth del Socorro is a young woman who is a single mother with two daughters. She has been working hard as a pharmacist at a health center in the city of León for the past three years. Ruth works Monday through Friday from 7:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. Her job enables her to support her two beautiful daughters.

Ruth approached CEPRODEL in order to request a loan to pay her mother’s medical expenses, which includes the cost of consultations and medicines. It should be mentioned that Ruth hopes that her mother will recover quickly.

loans.use: to pay for her mother's medical consultations and medicines.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El señor Oscar, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia, hombre humilde y trabajador, el quiere lo mejor para sus hijos por eso lucha dia a dia para segir mejorando sus condicones de vida, el cultiva piña, y actualmete querie de capital para darle un optimo mantenimiento a sus siembros, gracias al este nuevo financiamineto que se le ha otorgado podra comprar los insumos  y fertilizantes necesarios para que la plaga y el mal clima no le afecte a sus cultivos, Agradece la confianza brindada por Afodenic y Fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar lives with his family in the town of Ticuantepe. He is a humble and hardworking gentleman. Oscar wants the best for his children, so he strives each day to continue improving their living conditions.

He grows pineapples and is currently in need of capital so that he can keep his crops in optimum condition. Thanks to this new loan he will receive, Oscar can buy supplies and needed fertilizers that will allow his crops to withstand pests and bad weather. He is grateful for the trust that AFODENIC and Kiva have demonstrated.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies for maintaining his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Irma Iris

texts.es: La Señora Irma tiene 42 años de edad, está casada,tiene 3 hijos, reside en San Juan Pueblo en compañía de su esposo e hijos. Desde hace 2 años inicio su negocio a través de una tienda de comestibles donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como: granos básicos, carnes, pan, medicamentos, churros, refrescos y productos de higiene. Doña Irma ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras con el propósito de surtir su tienda comprando Granos basicos, carnes, lacteos, productos de abarrotes y ofrecer mayor y mejor variedad de productos. Con esta inversión espera un incremento en sus ventas e ingresos, mejorar su calidad de vida y poder ayudar a sus hijos a graduarse.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in San Juan Pueblo.

Two years ago, Irma started a grocery business where she sells household products such as basic grains, meats, bread, medicines, donuts, soft drinks, and toiletries. She has decided to request a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can restock her store with basic grains, meats, dairy products, and other groceries in order to offer a wider and better variety of products. With this investment, Doña Irma hopes to increase her sales and her income. She also expects to improve her quality of life so that she can help her children graduate.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, dairy products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de golosinas, venta de artefactos, cabinas telefónicas, venta de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que estaba formando un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de kiosco de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, con un capital básico con el que contaba observó.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de golosinas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of six members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. María serves as the treasurer. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as managing a neighborhood store, selling snack foods, selling appliances, operating phone booths, and selling candy.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. María. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who wanted to form a group. María currently has a kiosk where she sells candy. She has become knowledgeable about this business since she started it years ago with some startup capital she had on hand.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying snack foods. She acquires her inventory at the fairs in the city of La Paz and then sells it later at her kiosk. Working in this manner enables her to generate income. María is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, María said that she enjoys the training seminars about health and savings.

loans.use: to buy snack foods.

loans.name: Oneyda María

texts.es:
El Jicaral es un bello municipio ubicado en el departamento de León a 96 Km, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, es aquí donde vive la joven Oneyda María. 

 Oneyda María se llama la Joven de 35 años de edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, cuenta con 4 hijos bajo su cargo trabaja como maestra de educación primaria, su esposo se dedica como agricultor, con lo poco que produce con su propio esfuerzo a duras pena ayuda en el sustento diario de su hogar. 

 Hoy en día se le ha presentado una oportunidad de poder mejorar su casa de habitación, esto sería de gran importancia para vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, por tal razón solicita un crédito a través de kiva y ceprodel, para la compra de: Cementó, Arena y Pago de Mono de Obra Para la mejora de su vivienda.

Agradece a kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado a través de estos pequeños créditos y que  siempre piensan en las personas pobres de darle la oportunidad vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
El Jicaral is a beautiful municipality located in the department of Leon, 96km away from the city. Many enterprising people live there, including young Oneyda Maria.

Oneyda Maria is a 35-year-old young woman who fights for her family. She has four children in her care and works as a primary school teacher. Her husband makes a living from agriculture. With the little that she earns by her own efforts she helps with the daily support of her home.

She has been presented with an opportunity to improve the house she lives in. This would be of great importance in order to live in better conditions with her family. For this reason she is requesting a loan through Kiva and CEPRODEL for the purchase of cement and sand, and to pay for labour, in order to improve her home.

She is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for the help they have given her through these small loans, for their constant thoughts for poor people, and for giving her the opportunity to live in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand and pay for labour

loans.name: Adriel

texts.es:
Adriel, de 65 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre y responsable, el esta casado y tiene 7 hijos, vive en la casa heredada de sus padres junto a sus hermanos, sus hijos como ya son adultos tienen independencia, por ese motivo el vive únicamente con su esposa.El trabajo de Adriel es brindar servicio de vulcanizado a vehículos menores como motos y mototaxis. Tiene su taller instalado en su casa en donde también ha establecido su tienda de venta de repuestos y ahí pone a la venta diversos artículos vehiculares como faros, rodajes, llantas, aros y espejos. Realiza labores como bajada de motor, cambio de rodajes, cambio de aceite, parchado de llantas entre otros. Ejecuta esta actividad desde hace 22 años y con ello pudo brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario para su crianza ,trabaja con el apoyo de dos de sus hijos quienes le ayudan a realizar algunas funciones y de esta manera cumple con su trabajo de manera óptima. 
Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede trabajar en la comodidad de su hogar además de hacerlo en compañía de sus hijos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles y está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos como faros, llantas y rodajes para su venta y uso en reparaciones vehiculares.
texts.en:
Adriel, age 65, is a cheerful and responsible gentleman. He is married and has seven children. Adriel lives with his siblings in a house that he inherited from his parents. Since his children are adults who live independently, his immediate family only consists of himself and his wife.

Adriel provides tire repair services for smaller vehicles, such as motorcycles and mototaxis. He has a repair shop set up in his home, but he also operates a store where he sells spare parts. Adriel sells different vehicle parts such as headlights, gaskets, tires, rings, and mirrors. The types of jobs that he performs include engine tune-ups, gasket replacement, oil changes, tire patches, and other services. He has been in this line of work for 22 years and it enabled him to provide everything his children needed while they were growing up. Adriel works with two of his sons who help with some of the jobs. This allows him to complete the work in a timely fashion.

Adriel enjoys his job because he can work comfortably from home. He also gets to be around his children. Adriel is taking this opportunity to request 2,000 PEN. He is pleased with the financial support that has been given to him and is confident that he can advance in his work. Adriel promises to be punctual with his payments.

The amount he requested will be used to buy spare parts such as headlights, tires, and gaskets that he can sell and use in making vehicle repairs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles and mototaxis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yams and corn.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
Abrahan , tiene 25 años de edad , es soltero y vive junto a sus padres quienes estan muy orgullosos de tener un hijo laborioso.Tiene por principal oficio la producción de cacao orgánico.
Desde muy niño apoyó en labores menores a su madre logrando con el tiempo ganar mayor experiencia que le permitió administrar parte de los terrenos de sus familiares.
Para desempeñar  con fluidez las labores de mantenimiento el cual parte desde realizar periódicamente la poda de maleza convoca a jornaleros del lugar tanto como para la cosecha.Es un trabajo según comenta muy reconfortante  puesto que las ganancias finales dependen de la total dedicación brindada.
Su principal inconveniente inicial fue el de no contar con capital para la adquisición de plantas almácigo para reemplazar árboles desfasados pero despues logró juntar el capital necesario para salir adelante con sus sembríos .Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y esta agradecido por la confianza brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera responsable.Con los 3,000 nuevos soles otorgados espera contratar trabajadores del lugar para desempeñar el primer deshierbo de campaña .
texts.en:
Abrahan is 25 years old and single. He lives with his parents, who are very proud to have a hardworking son. Abrahan’s main job is producing organic cacao.

As a very young boy, he helped his mother with the smaller tasks. Over time, he gained more experience and this helps him manage part of the land that belongs to his family. In order to carry out the work of maintaining his crops, he must undertake the task of removing weeds. This requires him to hire local workers who also help with the harvest. Abrahan says that he finds the work very comforting because the gains in the end are dependent on his total dedication.

His main challenge at first was not having the capital to acquire seedlings to replace the trees that were no longer productive. Once he was able to raise the necessary capital, Abrahan could proceed with his planting his crops. This is his first Kiva loan and Abrahan is grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated. He promises to submit his payments in a responsible manner.

With this loan of 3,000 PEN, Abrahan plans to hire local workers so that the first round of weeding can begin.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque se siente bien trabajando con la Institución y por la atención que se le brinda. Este préstamo le permitirá comprar maíz, leña, gas y cal para seguir con su negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo mucho a fortalecer el negocio y obtuvo ingresos. El grupo familiar se mantiene, las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que logro adquirir materia prima de una sola vez.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan because she feels good about working with PADECOMSM and the service that she has received. This loan will allow her to buy corn, firewood, gas, and lime so that she can continue her business.

Her previous loan was a great help in strengthening her business and with generating income. Her family remains the same, her financial condition has improved, and she was able to acquire supplies once again.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas, and lime.

loans.name: Abavumvu Rango Group

texts.fr:
Vincent est membre du groupe ABAVUMVU RANGO, il a 37 ans , il est marié et a 4 enfants , le plus grand a 9 ans et le plus petit a 1 an.Il a étudie les études primaires.

il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les ruches modernes.
il `attend aucune difficulté de remboursement.

ses stratégies pour la croissance de son activité est de demander d`autre pret pour le financement de son activit♪0.
ses ambitions est d`être l`apicuteur proffessionnel et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Vincent is a member of the ABAVUMVU RANGO group.  He is 37 years old, married, and he has four children between the ages of 9 and 1.  He completed primary school.

He is requesting this loan to buy some modern beehives.  He is not expecting any difficulty repaying his loan.

In order to develop his activity, he is planning to take additional loans as a means to finance his business.  His ambition is to become a professional beekeeper.  As far as his family is concerned, his goal is to ensure that his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy modern bee hives.

loans.name: Dúo San Antonio Aguas Calientes Group

texts.es: DÚO SAN ANTONIO AGUAS CALIENTES esta conformado por dona Irma Elisa quien es la líder del grupo  ella tiene 32 años de edad,  tiene 2 hijos (uno de 7 y 5 años, actualmente estudian en la escuela de su localidad) ella se dedica a la elaboración de Güipiles típicos (güipiles de San Antonio) ya que desde hace 22 años ella los distribuye en su comunidad, elabora 2 Güipiles al mes con ayuda de una trabajadora su sueño es poder distribuir mas sus tejidos a otros de departamentos, ella solicita su crédito para la compra de materiales para elaborar sus tejidos (hilo en variedad de colores, hilo para urdir.) y así ayudar a su familia a poder ayudar a su familia, ya que podrá elaborar otro güipil y satisfacer la demanda de  sus clientes porque posee varios pedido de tejidos.
texts.en:
The San Antonio Aguas Calientes duo includes Irma Elisa, who is the leader of the group. She is 32 years old. She has two children, one who is seven years old and one who is 5 years old, who currently go to school in her town. She makes her living creating traditional San Antonio huipils [traditional woven tunics]; she has been distributing them in her community for 22 years. She makes two huipils per month with the help of an employee. 

Irma Elisa's dream is to be able to sell more of her weavings in other departments [of Guatemala]. She is requesting her loan for the purchase of materials for creating her weavings like thread in a variety of colors and thread for the warp [the lengthwise threads held in tension over the loom]; that way, she will be able to help her family by making more huipils and satisfying her customers, as she has several orders for weavings.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to create traditional weavings.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana, junto a su esposo trabajan día a día para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, su marido con su trabajo y ella con la venta de ropa ha podido pagar sus créditos que ha utilizado para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, este nuevo crédito lo utilizara para anexo de cuarto, para ello necesitara comprar arena, bloques, cemento, hierro, por lo que espera continuar trabajando con financiamiento para lograr hacer estas mejoras para vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Doña Ana and her husband work day after day so that their two children can get ahead. Her husband has a job and she sells clothing in order to pay off their home improvements loans that have made their living conditions better.

This new loan will be used to add an extension to a room. Ana needs to buy sand, blocks, cement, and iron so that the work can continue. With this financing, she will be able to make these improvements so that her living conditions can get better.

loans.use: to buy sand, blocks, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Leonardo Fabio

texts.es:
Leonardo de 40 años de edad, es un hombre humilde y trabajador, el cual ha logrado salir adelante gracias al sacrificio y el esfuerzo por. Se dedica principalmente a la venta y reparación de bicicletas, actividad que aprendió gracias a su primer trabajo y que le permitieron tomar experiencia. 
Hoy es un hombre que lucha por un sueño, convertir su microempresa en el mejor negocio de su localidad y para ello necesita invertir en la compra de bicicletas y repuestos a fin de garantizar una mejor calidad en la prestación del servicio. 
Leonardo no cuenta con los recursos para realizar dicha inversión por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito. Espera que sus sueños puedan cumpliesen para garantizarle a su familia una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Leonardo, age 40, is a humble and hardworking gentleman. He has been able to move forward because of his sacrifice and effort. His main business activity is selling and repairing bicycles. He learned this trade thanks to his first job, which allowed him to gain experience.

Today, Leonardo strives to fulfill his dream of turning his micro-enterprise into the best business in his town. To accomplish this, he needs to invest in the purchase of bicycles and spare parts so that he can guarantee that he provides the best quality service.

Leonardo does not have the resources to make this investment, so he is requesting a loan. He hopes to fulfill his dreams so that his family can be in better financial condition.

loans.use: to buy bicycles and spare parts.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married and has seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past four years, she has owned a restaurant, where neighbors and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of a fluctuation in the number of clients, at certain times, resulting in perishable foods going to waste.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her restaurant into a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 38-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her five daughters and two sons. She is a very hard-working tailor who wants to expand her business. Nasreen and her husband's biggest goal in life is to give higher education to all of their children and for each of them to be an independent human being in the future. But, because of financial constraints, it seems difficult for them to turn their dream into a reality. Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new sewing machine so she can stitch up more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally.
She hopes, with the help of this loan, that she will be able to expand her business and reach her desired net income. That would enable her to provide quality education to her children and fulfill all of their basic needs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machine to allow her to sew more dresses.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is from Kapan town. He earns income by selling clothes at his store and he works hard to sustain his family of 5: wife, two daughters and a son. Suren's eldest daughter, Nara is a 20-year-old student who studies at Yerevan State University. A few months ago Suren applied for the loan to pay for his daughter’s education.
Now, with a good credit history behind him, Suren has applied to SEF International for a second loan. With the help of this loan Suren will pay for Nara's university tuition for the second semester.
The loan is very important for Suren and his whole family. Suren is doing his best to help Nara become a good specialist and accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition of the second semester.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 58-year-old man married to Enrita. They have three children aged 23, 15 and eight years old respectively.
He is a dairy farmer and has done this for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES. 61,000. He has now requested his second loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy a heifer and dairy feed.
He will use the profits to buy another cow and to repay his loan. His dream is to become financially and economically stable from his dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has been blessed with three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She cites food and school fees as her major challenges.
Amina has operated a fruit selling business which she sells to her neighbors’ and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of bulkiness of the fruits hence a high cost of transportation.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase additional sacks of fruits. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits.

loans.name: Kaliku

texts.en: Kaliku is a 50-year-old married man with twelve children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He sells fish in order to get money to support his big family and the business is lucrative due to busy market. He started the business in 1999. A lack of preservation equipment and inadequate capital affects the business. His dream is to own a refrigerated van. Kaliku intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 21-year-old young, energetic and hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and two children. Her husband is an auto mechanic by profession and his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses.
Saba wants to educate her children in good schools so that they can have a bright future. Currently she can’t send them to good schools due to the financial problems and she is worried about their future. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She is a very skilled woman and she wants to open a beauty parlor in her house to generate an alternative source of income for her family. She would purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, creams, facials scrubs, makeup kits, etc. and would also purchase some chairs for her salon. She is very hopeful she will get this loan as she could start her own business with this loan that would benefit her husband and her family. She would spend the profits on the education of her children and pay her monthly loan installments.

loans.use: to start beauty parlor business to support the education of her two children.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and blessed with four children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Mishi cooks food to sell at the market and sells to town dwellers and people passing by. She cites food spoilage, leading to losses, as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.
With the KES 30,000 she wants purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. 
She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase to food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Giap

texts.en:
Giap was born in 1965 and has two children. The oldest child is adult, and the younger child is in the sixth grade. Her husband is a fisherman and earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Giap sells bananas and raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy food for her pigs and buy bananas. She hopes to repair her pig enclosure and build a house.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs and buy bananas.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luis, hombre humilde, trabajador, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa busca siempre como salir adelante para tener mejores condiciones de vida, ella es comerciante vende Frutas y Verduras y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, con este nuevo Credito el señor Luis dara Matenimiento a sus cultivos comprara: Fertilizantes, Triple, Urea, Completo etc. Agradece a Afodenic y fondos Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado todos estos años.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis is a humble and hardworking man that lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Together with his wife, he strives to get ahead and have better life conditions. His wife is a saleswoman that sells fruits and vegetables and helps him with the home expenses.

With this new loan, Mr. Luis will give maintenance to his plantations, buying fertilizers and other supplies. He appreciates the support given by AFODENIC and Kiva funds all these years.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of his plantations.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is 35 years old, a married woman and mother of one son and a daughter. She is living in a remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband, who is an automotive mechanic by profession, is the only person earning money in the family, but his income is not enough to fulfill the basic needs of his family. Therefore to contribute, and to support her husband, Noreen wants to generate some income by sewing clothes. She already has excellent experience from doing this for a year. Noreen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to start her business. With the profit she will provide her children a quality education and fulfill their other needs. Currently she is living in a rented house with her family, so her biggest aim in life is to build her own house and live happily with her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine in order to start a tailoring business

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 37 years old and come from Migori County, which is located in western part of Kenya. He is married and has three children who are 13, seven and three years old respectively.

Jared sells shoes in Migori market, a business he has been operating for the last 15 years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 10000. He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more pair of shoes for sale. Jared will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business to help growth.

Jared has a dream of making his business become stable enough to enable him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en:
Flora is 64 years old and lives in Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She is a widow with 7 children.    
Flora has a shop that sells grocery products. She has had this business for 6 years. Flora requested a loan to purchase assorted grocery items to sell.
Flora has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.
Flora is the leader of a 5-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 boxes of grocery items and 3 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with nine children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanaisha's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha operates a clothes-selling business, where she sells clothes at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, Mwanaisha wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Santa Fe Ocaña Group

texts.es:
DUO SANTA FE OCAÑA
El encargado de este grupo es el señor Ricardo quien tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a la siembra de rosas, el vive en caserío Santa Fe Ocaña un lugar donde la naturaleza es hermosa.  El tiene 9 años de iniciar su propio negocio y ya cuenta con varias plantaciones de rosas la cual está muy agradecido con sus padres por sus enseñanzas y así poder ser un hombre de bien.
