Don Jose tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos y reside en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Don Jose tiene un taller de reparacion de maquinaria y equipo pesado. Este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años con el proposito de crecer mas economicamente, el es muy conocido por el servicio que brinda de buena calidad y tiene bastante demanda de clientes.Don Jose ha solicitado varios creditos con Odef los cuales le han ayudado mucho a mantenerlo activo. Actualmente solicita el sexto de 17000 lempiras el cual invertira en comprar herramientas que necesita para el desempeño de su trabajo como, llaves ajustables y de cruz, empaques, aceites, grasas etc.Con esta inversion solventara la demanda de trabajo en su negocio. los planes que tiene es hacer el taller  mas grande para poder darle a su familia bienestar economico.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Jose has a machinery and heavy equipment repair shop.  He started this business 15 years ago with the goal of growing financially.  He is very well known for his good quality service and he has enough customer demand.  

Jose has requesting various loan with Odef which have helped him stay active.  Currently he is requesting his sixth loan for 17000 lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of tools that he needs to do his work such as adjustable keys and cross keys, gaskets, oils, grease, and more.  This investment will resolve the demand in his business.  He plans to make the workshop larger to be able to give his family financial wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase tools such as adjustable and cross keys, gaskets, oils, grease, and other items to repair cars.

loans.name: Wajibu Group

texts.en: Isaya is in his early 30s, married and the father of one son who is enrolled in a local school. For the last four years, he has earned a living by running a grocery store. He works from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm every day and makes a fair monthly profit. He is applying for his ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock missing items in his grocery store, buy several empty crates of sodas and beers and buy more chairs for his customers to use. He has paid back all these loans successfully and used the profits he earned to start building his house and to pay for household expenses. His dream is to one day become an international businessman. He will share this loan with his group, "WAJIBU," which has 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a new retail shop.

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
Abdel Karim is a 24-year-old single man who works providing maintenance for motorcycle generators and power generators. He is very experienced in his business, and he has gained customers' trust and support.

He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary spare parts for his business. He will also finish building a small part of his house. The increase in business capital will automatically increase his income because he can get the necessary spare parts at a competitive price, which will widen his net income range. He hopes to keep on developing himself and his business at the same time to make sure he continues to serve his customers well.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts

loans.name: Obura

texts.en:
Obura is a 31-year-old mother, from Kisumu County. She is married and supports three people in her family. Her spouse's name is Vincent, who is formally employed. She has two children who are five years and seven months old, respectively.

Obura sells stationery, a business she has been doing for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES 40,000.

She is applying for her fourth loan which she will use to purchase more stocks of stationery for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business.

She has a dream of growing her business into a large one, so as to earn more profit, to help cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of stationery for her business.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Doña Celestina, continúa con su negocio de venta de cds de música, videos, y refrescos los que vende ambulante día a día bajo el sol y lluvia, por otra parte su esposo le ayuda en los gastos del hogar con su labor como albañil, también tiene el apoyo de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad e independientes. El crédito que solicita es para cambiar el techo de su vivienda que está deteriorada, espera así poco a poco ir mejorando su casita, para vivir en buenas condiciones con la familia, agradece el poyo de prestamo que le brindan Afodenic y Kiva.
texts.en: Celestina daily sells music CDs, videos, and beverages as a street vendor, come rain or shine. Her husband's income as a bricklayer and her grown, independent children's support help her pay the household expenses. She has applied for a loan to replace the deteriorated roof of her house. She hopes to slowly continue making improvements so that her family can live in better conditions. She is grateful for the funding support offered by Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and beams.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 45 years old and lives in Kisumu, Kenya. She is a widow who supports her two children, who are 15 and 25 years old. She runs a business from a stall where she sells phone handsets and batteries. She has been in this line of work for seven years and makes a comfortable monthly income of KES. 60,000. She is requesting her fourth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more handsets to sell. She will use the additional profit she expects to earn to buy more items to sell from her stall. She dreams of making her business more successful so that she can provide for all of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy phone handsets in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic food products and to renovate her space.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has high poultry production and consumption. He has three children and has been in his current line of work for 21 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs and farm crops. He enjoys dairy farming and his biggest challenges are animal diseases and expensive animal feeds. He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo because it gives loans to farmers at a lower interest rate and also provides training on micro-finance. His highest monthly expense is school fees, and he plans to use the additional income he earns from this loan to pay for his children's education. He owns one cow, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water or other items such as a sewing machine, TV, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Samuel Enrique

texts.es:
Samuel, de  59 años de dad y su esposa son un claro ejemplo de que una verdadera familia permanece unida, sin importar las circunstancias adversas. Tras quedarse sin empleo, este hombre debió recurrir al subempleo para no morir de hambre y solventar las necesidades de su hogar. En medio de la necesidad por generar recursos económicos, La esposa de Samuel le sugirió dedicarse  a la venta ambulante de fritos y morcilla. 
Diariamente su esposa se levanta muy temprano para preparar los productos y posteriormente Samuel se dirige a las calles de su municipio a comercializarlos.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos con el fin de aumentar la producción y generar mayores ganancias que le permitirá mejorar calidad de vida del núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Samuel, 59, and his wife are a vivid example of a truly united family. They remain together even under difficult circumstances. After losing his job, he had to take a lesser job so that he didn't starve and he could buy basic household necessities. 

As he addressed the need to earn income, Samuel's wife suggested that he sell fried foods and blood sausage as a street vendor. She gets up early each day to make the items; later Samuel walks the city streets selling them. He has asked for a loan to buy supplies so that he can increase production and earn more, which will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic food products.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a 38-year-old farmer, in Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four, whose husband gives additional income, and she has done great, being in this agriculture business for the last 17 years.

This marks her fourth borrowing from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). She will purchase seeds and fertilizer for this planting season. She will use the anticipated profit to purchase animal feed for her livestock and chickens and she hopes to own a large piece of land for cultivating, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica vive en casa de casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.  Trabaja en atención al cliente en una institución financiera.  Además pasa clases de contabilidad en la noche que ocupa el resto del tiempo que le queda.

Al tener un sueldo bajo, ella se ve obligada a requerir préstamos para el pago de sus estudios. Es por eso que necesita el crédito para cubrir los gastos del instituto donde estudia Contabilidad; ella se encuentra en el tercer semestre.

El sueño de Yessica es terminar sus estudios y en el futuro poder independizarse.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito de Impro y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Yessica lives in her parents' house in the Sopocachi neighborhood in La Paz. She works as a customer service representative for a financial institution. She also takes accounting classes at night, which occupies the rest of her time. Since her salary is low, she needs loans to pay for her studies. 

She needs this loan to pay tuition at the institute where she is studying accounting. This is her third semester. Yessica's dream is to finish her studies and become independent. This is her first loan with Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition at the institute where she is studying accounting.

loans.name: Evnice

texts.en:
Evnice is 27 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She lives in Magibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation area in Liberia. Her husband is a businessman. For the past five years she has been selling rice, flour, peanuts, peppers, sugar, etc in the market. 

Evnice is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, flour, peanuts, peppers, sugar, etc. for her business. She faces the challenge of not having a good location in the market. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, flour, peanuts, peppers, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale, which she has been doing for over four years. She earns 10,000 PHP every month.

Maricel is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she joined in 2010, for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to improve her living situation and see that her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 42 and married.  She lives in Magibi county, the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her husband and children.  Her children range in age from 3 to 27; they are all in school. 

She has been selling rubber dishes in the market for ten years. Fatu started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this way of selling from her mother.  Her key challenge is the rainy season. 

Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, cups, bowls) for her business. 

She plans to build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, cups, bowls) for her business,

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old, widowed, and has two adult children who still depend on her.  She is a farmer in Voi Kenya, which she has been doing for three years, earning a great income.

Mary is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers for the planting season. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her farming business. She hopes to own a big farm in future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for planting

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 46 years old and operates a posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour), and also sells dry maize in Diani Mombasa. He is the father of three children; his wife also provides income for the family. He has been in this business for the last three years and has done well.

This loan marks his first borrowing from KADET LTD; he will use it to purchase dry maize for grinding in his posho mill, thereby growing his business. He will use the anticipated profit to pay his loan and educate his children. 

He hopes to own a maize grain wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize for his posho mill

loans.name: Julieth

texts.en:
Julieth is 38 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She earns her living by owning and operating a business making concrete blocks in the local community. She has been in her business for over 4 years, and earns 2,000 PHP every month. 

Julieth joined GDMPC in 2011, and she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for labor services. 

Her hope and dream is to have a better life, and to save for the future.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to make concrete blocks.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina used her previous loan to buy hair chemicals, braids, and facial chemicals for use in her salon business. It was profitable, and she was able to pay the loan.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to buy hair accessories such as hair braids, hair bands, hair clips as well as a blow drier for use in her salon business. Sabina anticipates making more profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and open another salon.

loans.use: To purchase more hair braids, hair bands, hair clips, and a blow drier for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Farid

texts.es:
Farid es soltero y viven en alquiler con su mamá y su hermano menor en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica a la elaboración de frituras y las comercializa en diferentes tiendas de la zona donde vive. Actualmente su mamá se encuentra desempleada y Farid es el único sostén de su familia.

Requiere el crédito para la compra de una máquina cortadora de papa que facilitará el trabajo de Farid, ahorrará energía y además manipulará el alimento de una forma más limpia.

El sueño de Farid es crecer en su negocio y eventualmente conseguir una casa propia para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Farid is single and lives in a rented home with his mother and younger brother in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz.  He makes chips and sells them in different stores within the zone where he lives.  His mother is currently unemployed and Farid is the family’s only support.

He needs this loan in order to buy a potato cutter that will help him in his work.  Farid will save energy and will be able to handle the food in a cleaner way.

Farid’s dream is to grow his business and eventually buy a home of his own for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a potato cutter.

loans.name: Evgina

texts.en:
Evgina is 33 years old and lives in Margibi county, the largest rubber producing plantation in Liberia. She lives with her husband and four children, ages 6-9; they are all in school. 

She has been selling slippers and lappa (a traditional dress) for eight years in the market.  Her aunt taught her how to sell, and assisted her with money to established her business. 

Evgina is asking for a loan to buy more slippers and lappa for her business.

Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, and lappa (a traditional dress) for her business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida is 65 years old, widowed, and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis, Occidental. She owns and operates a business planting, harvesting, and selling bananas to earn a living. She has been in her business for more than five years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah used his previous loan to buy meat for his butcher shop.  He also used part of the loan to buy charcoal to sell, and it has been profitable.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to buy more meat and charcoal for his businesses, so he can meet customer demand. 

He hopes to expand his business by opening another butcher shop.  This will enable him to make more income and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more meat and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Katarine

texts.en:
Katarine is from Krashen village of Shirak region. She keeps livestock which currently includes three cows, 20 lambs and 20 chickens. Katarine also cultivates wheat and potatoes and sells the gathered harvest in the local market.

Together with her husband, Katarine works hard to sustain their family of three: Katarine, her husband, and 24-year-old daughter. The family's only income comes from selling agricultural products in the local market. So, in order to enlarge her farming activity, Katarine has applied for this loan.

With the loan's help, she will purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds and fertilizer for cultivation. The loan will help to cover farming costs and she will get an opportunity to expand her farm.

Katarine and her husband are very hard-working and their dream is to have a big farm and appropriate living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and seeds and fertilizer for cultivation.

loans.name: Nicole

texts.es:
Nicole es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como procuradora para una firma de abogados y en su tiempo libre se dedica al comercio de cosméticos ya que su sueldo no le alcanza para sus gastos generales.

Es por eso que necesita el crédito, para la compra de mercadería (make up sets, lápiz labial, perfumes, etc.)para poder seguir con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Nicole es poder crecer económicamente e independizarse.
texts.en:
Nicole is single and lives in her parents’ home in the Villa Fatima zone of the city of La Paz.  She works as an attorney for a law firm and sells cosmetics in her spare time because her salary is not enough to pay her general expenses.

She needs this loan in order to buy merchandise (make up sets, lipsticks, perfumes, etc.) so that she can continue with her business and improve her income.

Nicole’s dream is to be able to grow financially and become independent.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married with a family of six, one of whom is a dependent he inherited after the death of her guardian. He is one of the farmers whose hard work has enabled  him to have a big coffee plantation that has served as a model to the rest of the farmers in and  around his home area. 

Joseph is requesting a loan for 1,200,000 UGX,  which he will use to buy fertilizers and mulch for his plantation which is being greatly affected by soil erosion since his farm is in a hilly location. He has achieved a lot from his coffee sales, including paying some of his children’s school tuition up to the university level. His dream is to buy more land to plant more coffee for his children to manage after they have graduated since there are currently no available jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and mulch.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo, 38, lives in Khulo District with her husband and five children. The only source of income for the family is that earned by her husband who works as an inspector at a private company. It is hardly enough for food for them. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Dodo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her husband’s low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Dodo then requested a 1200 USD start-up loan from Credo. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as high-risk borrowers due to low incomes.

With her loan Dodo will begin trading in used clothing. She plans to buy used clothing at wholesale prices and then sell them at retail among her villagers. This will increase the family’s income and will significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to trade in used clothing.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community, which she has been doing for over four years. She earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

Pilar is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she joined in 2010, for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase spare parts and tires. Pilar plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Lotty

texts.en:
Lotty lives in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing region in Liberia. She lives with her husband and children. She is 32 years of age, and she stopped her education at 7th grade.

For the past six years she has been selling rice by the cup, in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this way of selling from people in the market, at the time before she began selling. She enjoys the business because of the number of experiences she has every day. Her plans are to purchase more rice by the bag, which will expand her business, and to build a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag, to expand her business

loans.name: Natruli

texts.en:
Natruli, 26, lives in the village of Ikalto in Telavi district with her husband, Zurab. The family owns a vineyard where Zurab grows grapes to make wine and vodka, which is sold at local markets. This is the only source of income for the family and is not enough to cover their monthly expenses. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Natruli requested a 2000 GEL start-up loan from Credo. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisions providing start-up and re-startup loans with easy terms to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as high-risk borrowers due to low incomes.

With her loan Natruli will buy clothes at wholesale, then sell them at retail in her village. Natruli is a very hardworking woman and will try her best to make her new business work. Part of her profits she will use for reinvesting and purchasing more clothes to develop her trade. The other part will be used to help cover monthly expenses and provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To buy clothes at wholesale and sell them at retail prices.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 45 years old and lives in  Margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing region in Liberia. She lives with her husband and seven children. Only four of her children are in school. The children are between 18 and 29 years old.

For four years Annie has been selling charcoal, at her shop in her community. She started her business with money given to her by her husband. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more charcoal to resell at her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She's from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Joselina raises bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Joselina joined GDMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her banana plants

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 74 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Clarin within Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a plantation where she grows coconuts to sell to earn a living. She has been in business for over eight years and earns 5,000 PHP a month.

Rita joined GDMPC in 2008 and is now applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay for help on her coconut plantation. She plans to use the additional profits to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for help on her coconut plantation.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 48 years old and lives in Margibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is unmarried and has five children between the ages of 3 and 25 years old. Only four of them are in school and they all live at home. Her boyfriend is a college student. Since 1986 she has been  involved in business, and presently she is operating a restaurant near the market where sells delicious Liberian food. She spends 12 hours per day at her business and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase food ingredients like pepper, fish, rice, onions, salt, and oil for her restaurant. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients like pepper, fish, rice, onions, salt and oil for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 36 years old and lives in Margibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 15 that are in school and live at home.

For the past nine years she has been running a shop where she sells rice by the cup. She learned this way of selling from her mother and enjoys the profit she makes from her business. She spends 9 hours at her business every day. 

Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 38 years old, married and lives in Margibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has five children that live at home. All of her children attend school. Her husband is a contractor. For the past 10 years she has been involved in business and currently she sells fish in the local market. She likes how her customers can buy from her and she enjoys how supportive she can be to her family. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plans are to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 45 years old and she lives in the Airport community in Liberia. She stopped her education in the 9th grade. She is married and has three children between 25 and 30 years old. They are living on their own and going to school. For the past 5 years she has been selling fish in the local market. One of the problems that she is facing is a goods shortage. She likes her business because it provide for her and her husband's needs. Her husband also works with her in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish in order to expand their business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to expand her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 39 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, with her husband and children. All her children are in school. They are between 10 and 17 years old. For six years, she has been involved with charcoal sales in the market. Her aunt taught her how to sell and by this means she was able to establish her own business. She makes a good profit and her business makes her popular. She is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for her business

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 

Sawsan  is a 60-year-old, married woman, from Rafah. She lives in a small house with her husband. Her husband works as a plumber in his own workshop. This job is the only source of income to the family. Sawsan's husband would like to improve his workshop by buying more plumbing equipment and goods. 

Sawsan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help the family to increase their income by buying new equipment and goods for the plumbing workshop.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and goods for her husband's plumbing workshop.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is 31 years old, married, and has two daughters. Her husband owns a small gifts store, which is profitable but not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Dalal is studying for her master at the university and wants to complete her studies by paying the university fees.  She is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Khadejeh

texts.en:
Khadejeh is married and works with her husband in their own store, selling consumer goods such as rice, milk, and chicken. The business is profitable but needs some improvements. 

Khadejeh is requesting a loan from FATEN for $2,000, which she will use to purchase needed stocks of basic goods that customers often request. This will increase sales and the family's income.

Khadejeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Saleh appears in her profile photo.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik has been a farmer for many years. He grows potatoes and has two cows, four calves and thirty chickens. He works hard growing potatoes and selling them in the local market.

To be financially secure and ensure a stable income for himself and his family, Gagik would like to expand his farm. He has requested a 2,500 USD loan through SEF to buy seed, fertilizer and fuel for transporting his harvest to market. The loan is critical to Gagik’s success.

With the help of the loan Gagik hopes to increase the income from his crops. He lives with his wife and son and does his best to ensure a better life for them.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Annita

texts.en:
My name is Annita, I am a second year student at Strathmore University pursuing a degree in Business Information and Technology. I chose to join Strathmore University because of its ability to produce skilled, disciplined and all rounded individuals. Strathmore University is a brand in itself, therefore making its students marketable in the job market.

I am taking the loan in order to acquire a laptop, which I need for studies. My chosen field of study involves a lot of computer work and sometimes when one does not have a personal computer to practice the skills taught in class, it may be very difficult for an individual to better their skills. I am very confident that if I own one, I will be able to sharpen my knowledge and skills in IT. I decided to take up this loan because at the moment my parents have a lot at hand and this program offered a reasonable repayment schedule that my parents can afford.

My dream is to be an entrepreneur in the IT field. After attaining my degree, I would like to work in an IT firm in order to have some experience before starting my own IT consultancy firm that will specialize in offering IT solutions to emerging problems in the business sector. In the meantime, I am waiting to join a program for a certification in networking in the same institution.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that will help her with her studies and gain more IT skills.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
My name is John, I am the last born in a family of six and from a single parent family. My mother, who I live, with runs a small scale retail business.

I chose to study Bachelor of Information Technology at Strathmore because the institution is best ranked in Kenya for both academic and extracurricular activities. It is the best place to nurture my football talent as the university was ready to accommodate me in its sports scholarship program. I am a third year student.

I am requesting a laptop loan from Kiva as this will help me in my fourth year project. With a laptop, it will be very convenient and effective to do my researches in the field of technology.

I would like to be a reliable and resourceful person in the future. After my graduation it is my dream to start up a firm in the technology field where people can acquire information, software, computers, laptops and other IT equipment and materials. It is also my dream to start up a sports academy where kids will develop and nurture their God-given talents. Kindly consider my humble request. Thanks in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that will help him conduct a research project

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 46 years old, married, and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantations in Liberia. She lives with her two children who live at home and attend school. 

For the past twenty-five years she has been involved in business and currently she sells palm oil. She likes how her customers buy from her and she enjoys how supportive she is to her home. She spends 8 hours with her business; she learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business, her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new equipment for his mechanical workshop.

loans.name: Najwah

texts.en:
Najwah, who appers in the photo, is a 50-year-old married woman. She has one son and five daughters. Najwah's husband works as an employee with a low wage that barely covers the family's basic needs and  education expenses. 

Najwah's daughter is studying at the university. Najwah wants to help her daughter to complete her studies. She is requesting a  USD loan from FATEN to help her daughter cover her university fees. This will ensure a better future for her daughter and it will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 49-year-old, Palestinian woman, from a small village called Arabah, near Jenin City. She has worked in a clothing store for the past few years and she loves her job. But, Maha would like to open her own clothing store in her area. She would like to sell clothes for different targets, like women and children. 

Maha took out a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her open her own clothing store. This will increase Maha's income. Maha is photographed in her clothing store.

loans.use: to pay the costs of opening her own store.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta, 33, lives in Margibi County, which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has five children between fourteen to nineteen years old, all of whom go school and live at home. Miatta herself left school after the fourth grade.

For the past fifteen years Miatta has been selling body cream, powder, spray, and bath soap. She started this business with a little money from her husband and learned how to sell from her auntie. She likes her business because of the customers it attracts.

Miatta is requesting a 16,000 LRD loan through BRAC Liberia to buy more body products for her business. She hopes to earn more in profits to help sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more body products for her business.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 30 year old married man. He is a father with one son and five daughters. 

For the past few years, Ammar has been taking care of his olive farm. The farm provides a good income, but it is still not enough. Ammar would like to buy a taxi and work on it in his free time. Ammar is requesting a 1000USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing the taxi. This will increase the family's income.

Ammar is shown in the picture, next to his taxi.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Subbhiyeh

texts.en:
Subbhiyeh is a married woman from Tulkarem city. She is a mother to three sons.

For the past ten years, Subbhiyeh has had a sewing workshop, sewing clothes for customers. This has been a profitable project. Subbhiyeh is requesting a 3000USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing an additional sewing machine. This will enable her to provide better quality service to her loyal customers. This, in turn, will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income.

This business has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of work.
Subbhiyeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Shafeeq

texts.en:
Shafeeq is a single Palestinian man from Rafah city. He owns a small store where he sells fruits and vegetables. His business is profitable but he needs money to make improvements.

Shafeeq seeks a loan from FATEN to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell. This will allow his income to increase and enable him to improve his family's standard of living.

Shafeeq appears in the picture.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a 34-year-old, married man, from Rafah. Basem has been working on a rickshaw for the past two years. He transports goods and inventory for a group of traders and, over time, he built strong relationships with them and became a well-known person in Rafah. 

Basem took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the cost of the rickshaw he works on. This loan will help Basem to improve his work. Basem dreams to buy another rickshaw. Basem is in the photo, leaning against his rickshaw.

loans.use: to cover the cost of buying a rickshaw.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal, 25, lives with his relative in Sana`a, Yemen. He works in the grocery and food-selling business, where he has been the proprietor of a business for more than two years.

Kamal began his enterprise with his own capital, money that he had saved with much effort and hard work. He feels very good because this business generates daily earnings for him as he sells his products in the community where he lives. One of his expectations is to expand his business.

Kamal wants to stock more food products and improve his sales; the additional earnings will allow him to continue investing in his business to enable it to grow. He is therefore requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, soft drinks, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario, el se dedica al  bordado de prendas de vestir como  disfraces folklóricos, de distintas fraternidades,  el se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, es trabajo que realiza es manual y le lleva mucho trabajo, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Alto Lima , este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Mario utilizara este préstamo para compra de telas y materiales para el bordado de sus prendas de vestir, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, El Sr. Mario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad del bordado de disfraces y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y no solo bordar si no confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir El Sr. Mario se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario makes a living embroidering garments such as folkloric costumes from distinct regions. He has had this job for several years. The work he carries out is manual and requires a lot of work. His workshop is located in the Alto Lima zone. 

This loan is his first one with the institution, and Mario will use it to buy fabric and materials to embroider his garments. He is requesting the loan because he lacks working capital. Mario faces challenges in his business including the need to continue improving the quality of embroidery on his costumes, and he will use his profits to continue increasing his working capital.

His dream is for his business to grow and not only to embroider but also to manufacture a variety of garments. Mario is happy and thankful to the institution for the its support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and work material

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil, a 41-year-old married father of five, lives in a rented house in Sana`a, Yemen. A teacher earning insufficient salary to pay for rent and provide for his family's needs, he wants to earn more money to better provide for his family.

Khalil is therefore requesting a loan of 349,999.92 YER to buy a taxi so that he can improve their living standards. He hopes to eventually open a grocery store and own his own house.

loans.use: to buy a taxi so he can continue improving the quality of his life.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El Sr.  Fernando tiene 28 años, el se dedica  a la  compra y venta de llantas de segunda mano, hace ya varios años, tiene su tienda  ubicado en la Zona del Plan 3000, donde ofrece variedad de llantas para todo tipo de vehículo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr.  Fernando va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de llantas por mayor de segunda mano, y así incrementar su capital de trabajo  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo y seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr.  Fernando va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  llantas  para seguir surtiendo su tienda, El Sr.  Fernando  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Fernando is 28 years old and makes a living buying and selling second-hand tyres.  He has had his store in the Plan 3000 area for some years and it is there that he sells a variety of tyres for all types of vehicles.  This loan is his second cycle with the communal bank. Fernando will use the loan to buy second-hand tyres in bulk and so increase his working capital.  He is applying for the loan due to a lack of cash and so that he can continue to improve his business.  Fernando will use the profits to continue buying tyres to keep working in his store.  Fernando is a very hard-working person and is very grateful for the opportunity being given to him.

loans.use: to buy used tyres.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., están trabajando juntas arduamente para poder crecer y por medio de ese trabajo poder dar a sus familias lo que necesitan.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Suni, quien ha hecho la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y ha arrojado que su ingreso está por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, por lo que se está esforzando por mejorar. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo y calzados, y con este trabajo está tratando de mejorar su economía y la de su familia, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en su negocio, para que de esa forma siga con sus ventas y tener así también los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad tan grande que reciben.
texts.en:
This group, "Las Emprendedoras", is on its seventh cycle in the women's committee programme.  Here all the women work and help each other to prosper.  They work hard together in order to be able to grow and, through work, to provide their families with what they need.

One of the members is Suni who, according the poverty elimination survey, is living below the poverty belt.  Suni is therefore working hard to improve her situation.  Suni makes a living selling clothing items and footwear.  With this work she is trying to improve her and her family's financial situation.  She is very hard-working and wants to prosper.

Suni is applying for a loan to invest in her business and to continue with her sales and have the income to help her family.  She is grateful for this big opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy clothing items and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна замужняя женщина с двумя детьми. Ей 23 года. Она проживает в районе Хуросон в южной части Таджикистана. Ее муж на рынке занимается торговлей. Сама Мавзуна тоже занималась торговлей. Однако она продала свой магазин и теперь хочет начать новый вид бизнеса,а именно заняться животноводством. У нее при дворе есть сарай и корм для скота. К тому же скотный рынок находится на расстоянии 1 км к ее дому. Поэтому Мавзуна обратилась за кредитом для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mavzuna is a married woman with two children.  She is 23 years old.  She lives in the Khuroson region in the southern part of Tajikistan.  Her husband trades at the market.  Mavzuna also trades.  But she sold her store and would now like to try a new type of business, raising cattle.  Her yard has a shed and feed for livestock.  In addition, the livestock market is 1km away from her home.  This is why Mavzuna applied for a loan for the purchase and sale of livestock.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Mojib

texts.en:
Mojib is 36 years old. He fights for his life and for his family. He is a teacher who gets a low salary. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His salary is not enough to provide for his family.

Mojib has been presented with an opportunity to be able to improve his house. This is of great importance to his family as they will be able to live in better conditions. For this reason, Mojib is requesting a loan of 200,000.00 YER from AMB to buy windows and a door to improve his home. 
He is grateful to the people who help with credit and who always think of the poor people and give them opportunities to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy windows and a door to improve his home.

loans.name: Sara Victoria

texts.es: Sara de 32 años de edad vive  en casa de su mamá con su mama y sus hermanos, posee una pupusería vende pupusas revueltas, de queso, frijol con queso entre otras, tiene 6 años con el negocio y es muy conocida en la localidad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija y con las ganacias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de la casa; Sara es una mujer muy responsable y muy dedicada a su trabajo, quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles, verduras, etc. Sara tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, con la ayuda ella confía que podrá llevar a su hogar una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Sara is 32 years old and lives at her mother's house with her mother and siblings.  Sara has a shop selling stuffed tortillas, made with cheese or cheese and beans, among other fillings.  She has had the business for six years and is well-known in the town.  Sara has a good customer base and, with the profits that she earns, she can contribute to the household bills.  Sara is a very responsible woman and is very dedicated to her work.  She wants to invest in the business so she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy corn, cheese, pork cracklings, beans, vegetables and more.  Sara has a good credit rating and a strong sense of morality.  With this loan she is confident that she will be able to bring greater financial stability to her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (cheese, pork crackling, corn and beans).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an abundant amount of food for her customers.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
This is Umazi. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to buy seedlings and for her farming efforts. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

Umazi would like to apply for another loan, this time for KES 50,000, to venture into another business of a retail shop. She would like to buy an inventory of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better; more items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and to pay the educational fees for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ndawa

texts.en:
Ndawa, a married man with four children, all of whom still attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ndawa has operated a milk selling business for the past four years, selling from home to his neighbors and retail shop operators. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business.

With the loan he is requesting, Ndawa wants to purchase packets of milk for resale. He dreams of expanding his business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packets of milk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small generator for personal use.

loans.name: Hemed

texts.en:
Hemed is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, Hemed has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. He cites theft and competition as his major challenge. 

Hemed is requesting a loan for KES 20,000 to boost his kiosk. He will purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to boost his kiosk by enabling him to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid has been operating a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. He is happy for the opportunity Yehu and Kiva lenders have given him. 

Rashid is requesting another Kiva loan of KES 50,000. He will use it to boost his kiosk, by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop, in the near future.

loans.use: to boost his kiosk, by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil

loans.name: Jamelin

texts.en:
Jamelin is 33 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month.

She has joined in GDMPC since 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to pay for motorcycle repair, to have a better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Shamima

texts.en:
Shamina is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. The other is an infant. Her husband is a driver, and he supports his family financially. They live at their own house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

Shamima has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators, in her business. 

With KES 70,000 loan, she wants to purchase a motorcycle with which she will venture into the transport business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and venture into the transport business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elina, a 53-year-old married mother of five, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a retail enterprise in the local community. In business for over six years, she earns PHP 10,000 every month.

A member of GDMPC since 2007, Elina has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase additional products to sell including noddles, sugar, coffee, shampoo and soap. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like noddles, sugar, coffee, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman and has two children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the KES 40,000 loan, Mwanahamisi wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, oil, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking fat, oil, wheat flour, and rice to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
For years, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites the high cost of maintenance as her major business challenge.

She is coming for another Kiva loan, of KES 50,000. With the loan money, she wants to purchase another motorcycle, to expand her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle, to expand her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a 56-year-old coffee farmer, is the married father of seven children, four of whom are at the lower primary level and three in higher institutions of learning. His income is derived solely from coffee and banana sales which have enabled him to construct a house and pay school fees for his children.

George's main challenge is low agricultural output, so he wants to buy manure to improve soil fertility to enhance his yields in the coming harvest season. He has therefore applied for a loan of ugx.1300000 from UGAFODE for this purpose.

George aspires to having the biggest coffee plantation in the area within the next two years and graduating to selling processed coffee by putting up his own coffee factory in the long term.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Tichakunda Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is part of Tichakunda Group. 

With the last loan, she managed to purchase household assets and is now able to pay school fees for her children from the extra income earned from the business with no problems. She is is looking forward to growing her poultry business and being able to employ people to assist her. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of USD 750 to buy more chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Eulalio Ernesto

texts.es: Don eulalio de 48 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Don Eulalio desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y tambien poder pagar el arrendamiento de la parcela donde siembra dud cultivos. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Eulalio is 48 years old. He is a man who is very responsible with respect to his household obligations; he has always been known for providing the best to his children. He currently lives with his wife and his children. He is very hardworking and he has always worked cheerfully and enthusiastically. He earns his living every year by growing the principal staple crops of the region, such as corn and beans. 

Eulalio hopes to increase his sales, so he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, soil amendments, fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies, as well as to pay rent on the parcel where he plants his crops. He hopes to have this support that he has requested given that he has no other monetary income; with the loan he will continue bringing home the daily bread without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and to pay rent for his fields.

loans.name: Leida Rosa

texts.es:
Leida es una mujer de 40 años de edad, luchadora y trabajadora desde su juventud. Gracias a su esfuerzo logró montar su propio restaurante, actividad que le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para el alimento, el vestuario y la educación de sus dos hijos.
Leida es una mujer de retos y proyectos, por eso ha decidido ver crecer su negocio y para lograrlo se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un fogón e insumos de la canasta familiar con el fin ampliar su portafolio de productos e incrementar las ventas logrando obtener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Leida is 40 years old and has been plucky and hard-working since she was young.  As a result of her efforts she managed to start her own restaurant, which has allowed her to earn an income to pay for food, clothing and an education for her children.

Leida has many challenges and plans and so has to decided to expand her business.  To do this she is applying for a loan to invest in a stove and to buy  staple supplies so she can offer a greater range of products and increase sales.  By doing this she will be able to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio es padre soltero y vive en anticrético en la zona de Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de calzados y  ahora también los fabrica.  Requiere el crédito para reemplazar una máquina para hacer calzados que es muy anticuada y gasta mucha energía por una más moderna y que le ayudará mucho en su trabajo.

El sueño de Florencio es hacer crecer su negocio y poder comprar una casa donde él y su hija puedan vivir tranquilos.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con Impro y la primera vez con Kiva.
texts.en:
Florencio is a single father who lives in a leased home in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz.  He sells all types of shoes and now makes them as well.  He needs this loan to replace a shoe-making machine that is very old and uses too much electricity, with a more modern one that will help him greatly in his work.

Florencio’s dream is to grow his business and be able to buy a house where he and his daughter can live peacefully.

This will be the second time he works with Impro and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new shoe making machine.

loans.name: Zorkin

texts.en:
Zorkin is a teacher, with 20 years of experience teaching in the local school. He lives in a small village called Ardenis and is involved in cattle breeding, as well as teaching. He keeps 17 cows, 173 lambs and 40 chickens.  Unfortunately a teacher's salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of five:  his three sons, wife, and Zorkin himself.

As cattle breeding helps the family to have stable income, it is very important for Zorkin to expand it.  He has requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This is very important for him, to feed his animals and continue the expansion of his business.  Zorkin is very hardworking and does his best to ensure a better future for his three sons.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Luis Horacio

texts.es:
Luis Horacio de 55 años, se dedicó a laborar en oficios varios  con el fin de conseguir el alimento y el dinero para el sostenimiento de su familia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de crispetas y papas fritas a las afueras de los colegios y de la iglesia de su localidad.  Esta idea de negocio surgió gracias a su hermano quien labora de forma similar en otro municipio. Luis desea que su negocio le genere buenas ganancias ya que es su única fuente de sostenimiento. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para el mantenimiento de la olla crispetera y la compra de insumos, para seguir con la elaboración y comercialización de sus productos.
Sueña con poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y comprar una vivienda para reducir los gastos  de arrendamiento.
texts.en:
Luis Horacio is 55 years old. He worked at different jobs to bring home food and money to support his family. For a year he has sold popcorn and french fries outside of high schools and church in his community. The idea for this business was born thanks to his brother who does the same work in another town. Luis wants his business to generate good income since this is his only form of support. To day he is asking for a loan to do maintenance on the popcorn popper and to buy ingredients to keep making and selling his products. 

He dreams of being able to offer his family a better quality of life and of buying a home to reduce renting costs.

loans.use: to do maintenance on a popcorn popper and to buy ingredients (potatoes, corn).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ribbons in different colors and sizes.

loans.name: Suliman

texts.en:
Suliman, 29, is a married man and has two children. He lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He is a joyful man who is full of life. He has faced financial problems. He works hard, as a motorbike driver, to improve his living standard. He said, his wife is an employer, who assists her husband to improve their children. 

He works to expand his business, to increase his profit. So, he applied for a Youth Loan of 163,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to buy an additional motorbike to put to work in his business. This will increase his income available for improving his living standard.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorbike to put to work in the motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is a 26-year-old from Dvin village. She lives with her mother and elder brother and, jointly with them, is involved in agriculture. They own an agricultural land, where they cultivate tomato and eggplant, and grow peach and apricot trees. They work hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local markets. As the main income of the family comes from land cultivation, it is very important for Margarit and her family to enlarge the land cultivation process.

Margarit has applied for this loan to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer, and also to cover the cost of labor to help with the cultivation. The loan is very important for Margarit and her family, to get an opportunity to cultivate more vegetables and increase their sales.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds and fertilizer, and also to cover the cost of labor to help with the cultivation

loans.name: Belal

texts.en:
Belal is 30 years old. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He owns and operates a retail business, selling spare parts in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over three years. He started his business with a small amount, which he had saved, to better serve his customers.

He would like to expand his business but he doesn't have sufficient money, due to few clients are coming to his business. So, he applied for a Youth Loan of 100,000 YER from AMB, with which he will buy spare parts for his business inventory. He plans to use his loan to strengthen his business and generate more profits. This will help him to support his parents and plan for his future, eventually having a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business inventory

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is 63 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a copra production in the local community. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns PHP 10,000 every month. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2008 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase additional materials for making copra. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making copra.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beehives.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a married man, 32 years old, who has three children. He is a hard worker, and he lives with his family in Sana`a, Yemen. He has operated a small lorry transportation service for 10 years, as his main source of income. From this business he earns enough to cover his daily expenses.

He is taking out a loan of 99,999.96 YER from AMB. He will use it to buy a machine for his small lorry transportation business, to continue his work. He wants to expand his business even more, in the future. He hopes to own an additional small lorry, to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine for his small lorry transportation business

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van was born in 1979. She has three children who are aged 14, 10 and 5. Her husband and she are granite miners. Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Van also grows vegetables to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for twelve years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

Van has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy labor protective gear and tools to quarry more granite. 

She always wants to raise her children up well, repair her house and build a pigsty.

loans.use: to buy labor protective gear and tools to quarry more granite.

loans.name: Agala

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Agala from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe, which means “he who does not sleep". She is married with three children, all attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Agala runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges faced are lack of capital. 

Agala has requested a loan of $800 for restocking. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve payment of school fees and taking care of her dependents. 

In the future, Agala dreams of opening a big supermarket.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for resale.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun lives in the town of Goris with his parents. At the age of 24, upon returning from two years of service in the army, Harutyun found a way to make a living by running a farm. His farm is small and includes only 7 cows, but he works hard, produces milk and milk products, and sells them in the local market.

Because agriculture helps him to have a stable monthly income, Harutyun would like to expand his farm. He has applied for a loan to purchase three cows and forage to feed his livestock. The loan is very important for Harutyun to expand his farm, earn more agricultural income, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three cows and forage to feed them

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en: Sahak has been involved in agriculture for 12 years. He owns a farm that currently includes 6 mother pigs, 59 little pigs, and 100 chickens. He also owns agricultural land where he cultivates barley and wheat and grows peach trees. Due to his hard work, Sahak's farm is one of the best farms in the whole village. He would like to enlarge his farming business but unfortunately does not currently have sufficient financial means. So he has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, forage to feed the livestock and fuel to transport the harvest to the market. The loan is very important for Sahak to continue the expansion of his farm and earn more agricultural income, income which is vital for him to sustain his family (pictured in the photo).

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, forage to feed the livestock, and fuel to transport the harvest to the market

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fortaleza está en su ciclo número diez del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permite saber el nivel de ingresos de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mercedes, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza cero, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo que ella hace pudo mejorar muchísimo, ella cuenta que tiene una despensa, en la que vende todo tipo de productos, tiene bien surtido y gracias a eso está saliendo adelante, ayuda a su familia y mejora sus ingresos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, productos a granel y demás, con lo que podrá seguir invirtiendo en sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza group is in its tenth loan cycle of the women's communal bank programme. Each of the women is doing the elimination of poverty survey, which tells them the income level of each of them. 

One of the members is Mercedes who in the last survey showed a poverty level of zero, since thanks to her efforts and work she has been able to improve a lot. She says that she has a grocery store from which she sells all kinds of products, she has a good selection and thanks to that she is succeeding, she helps her family, and improves her income. 

She is applying for this loan to invest in buying fruit, vegetables, loose products and others, with which she will keep investing in her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, loose products and others

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su mama y sus hermanos en casa propia ella se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol, tambien trabaja como empleada de oficios domesticos cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganacias que le quedan de la venta de los cultivos y con el pago de su trabajo ayuda a su mama a solventar algunos de los gastos que tienen en el hogar, ella desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un credito el cual le ayude a comprar todo lo necesario para sus cosechas como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, entre otras herramientas y asi poder seguir solventando sus gastos y seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: This client lives with her mother and her siblings in their own home. She makes a living from agriculture. Her main crops are corn and beans. She also works as a maid near her residential area. With her earnings from her work and the profits left over after selling her crops she helps her mother to settle some of the expenses that they have at home. She wants to increase her sales, so she is requesting a loan to help her buy all that is necessary for her crops, such as fertilizers, compost, and seed. She will thereby be able to continue settling her expenses and helping her family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijo en casa propia, es muy responsable y trabajadora ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene varios años con su negocio ya que su familia siempre han tenido tienda y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por eso se ha hecho de mucha clientela y tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere seguir con el negocio y por eso quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital, solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: This client lives with her husband and two children in their own house.  She is very responsible and a hard worker, and owns a store where she sells essential goods such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, etc.  She has been in business for several years since her family has always been in the trade.  This is where she gained the sales experience she uses to earn more profit.  The store is in her house which is situated in a busy district so she has many customers who visit her well-stocked store.  She wants to continue with the business and make a new investment, but does not have the necessary capital.  She is requesting a loan to buy the goods she needs for the store, and is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She is confident she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su madre y con su padre el cual trabaja en un taller, la madre es quien tenia la venta de ropa pero por su edad decidio dejarsela desde hace 2 años a su hijo, el es quien se encarga de administrar el negocio y le ha hido muy bien tiene buena clientela y con las ganancias que obtiene va comprando diario la mercaderia y va solventado los gastos de su hogar, el solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia como zapatos, bufandas, mateles para mesas los cuales se venden con mas facilidad y las faldas y blusas que le dejan mucha ganancia y asi poder ayudar a sus padres en los gastos que tienen y el puede surtir con mas productos y poder generar mejos ingresos.
texts.en: This client  lives with his mother and his father (who works in a workshop).  His mother is the one who used to own the clothing business but two years ago, owing to her age, she decided to leave it to her son.  He is now in charge of running the business and he is doing very well.  He has a good customer base and uses the profits he makes to buy merchandise on a daily basis and cover his household expenses.  He is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes, scarves and tablecloths, which sell very easily, and skirts and blouses, which are very profitable.  In this way, he will be able to help his parents with their expenses, stock his business with more products and make better income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (shoes, clothes and tablecloths)

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface lives in Kwale county, in southern Kenya. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Bonface is married, and has six children. He has been farming for 25 years and is currently growing maize and mangoes on his land. He is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will help pollinate his crops, thereby increasing his production. He also likes the medicinal properties of honey and he hopes to use some of the honey produced by his hives for personal use. 

This is Bonface’s first loan and he will use the income generated from his beehives to pay his children’s school fees. In the future, Bonface hopes to start a tree plantation on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Empezó hace varios años con la venta de cosméticos luego comenzó a vender artículos pequeños para el hogar gracias a Dios le ha ido bien le gusta lo que hace.

Compra mercadería al por mayor y la vende con su esposo trabajan de  7h00 a 21h00. Venden artículos varios como tostadores, batidores y planchos. 

La dificultad que ella tiene en su negocio es el miedo a que le roben ya que hay muchos ladrones. Tambien su enfermedad ya que el es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida). Si  está casada su esposo a parte de la ayuda que le da vendiendo los articulos tambien es maestro electricista tiene un hijo de 9 años estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo va a comprar artículos de cocina como tostadoras, batidoras, planchas etc. Su sueño es poder disfrutar junto  a su familia y poder tener un gran local  donde pueda vender más artículos y dar trabajo a más personas
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil.  She started out a number of years ago selling cosmetics, and later she started to sell small household items.  Thanks to God the business has done well, and she enjoys her work.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise at wholesale which she will sell with her husband.  They work from 7am until 9pm.  They sell a variety of items such as toasters, blenders and irons. 

One difficulty she faces with her business is the fear that she will be robbed, because there are a lot of thieves in her area.  Another challenge is her illness, because she is a patient living with HIV/AIDs.  She is married and her husband, in addition to helping with her sales, also works as a master electrician.  They have a son who is 9 years old and who attends a public school.
